description:
My friend and I had decided to not go to a Thai place on Valencia because we wanted to support a mom and pop restaurant he always goes to. 

I hate Thai food due to certain reasons and reluctantly agreed to go since I wanted him to be happy too. I'm so glad we did. 

The doodles all over this place by the (what i assume the child) is adorable. Its even embroidered into the table cloths and makes you feel welcome at home. 

It was 30 minutes till closing and they kindly accepted us in. I ordered a seafood red curry medium spicy. It was so flavorful, albeit a bit too spicy for my weak mouth, and the seafood was great quality. The shrimp was meaty and large and the eggplant was perfectly fried before the sauce was added in. Texture of everything was perfect with rice. I wanted to scrape everything off with a squeegee and take it home to add to more rice. 

Service was prompt and warm. I love this place and would only go here for Thai in the future.
author: Stacey T.

description:
The cashier was very friendly and the food was prepared quickly!

However, I wasn't impressed with the quality of any of the items we ordered. Both the curry and noodles were bland. The chicken wings looked promising and had good flavor, but there wasn't much meat on the bones and they were overdone and dry.

With Amphawa so close I won't order from Tawan's again - but this is totally fine in a pinch!
author: Jonathan B.

description: Customer service was great and kind! They've been around for around twenty year which is a pretty long time, and I love that it's pretty quiet in there! They allow you to customize your spice level which is pretty cool. The food is a little bit on the salty side, but other than that it's delicious and fresh!!
author: Linda N.

description: This place is a perfect hidden gem of a restaurant. If I could give an additional 2 extra stars I would. The Tom kha gai soup was mind blowing. 13/10 would come here again.
author: Krista N.

description:
I was looking for some quick ethnic food with a take out option on my way out of town, and here we are! Very easy to order through the app, although the prep time was off- 45-60 mins according to the app, and ready when I walked into the business at the 30 minute mark; not a complaint but more of an observation.
I would probably not bring a crowd here as tables are limited to 4 with a central aisle. Also I would avoid traditionally busy times as it looks like it would get loud.
Food was outstanding, just exactly what I had hoped for. Great neighborhood spot!
author: Tony M.

description:
Legit Thai food. Spicy scale off (less spicy than expected).

Calamari salad - tasted as it should have.
Som tum salad - tasted as it should have but beware that if you add salted crab, it is a $1.20 extra and will not be communicated to you.
Guay-Teaw Tom-Yum Goong - not worth it. Rice noodles with white mushrooms and shrimps in sour and spicy soup. Nothing fancy, really.
Pla- Dook Pad- Ped - flavorful and would order again.
author: Hello E.

description: Food is fantastic, service decent, place is clean but be careful where you park, DPT tags quite frequently. Some poor soul parked in the yellow and got it, what an expensive lunch.  I had the yellow curry and #20.
author: Kevin L.

description:
My fiance Alex had a craving for pad gra prow and found this restaurant on Yelp. We'd never ordered from here before, but were interested in trying a new restaurant for dinner. When the food arrived, he asked "what's this? °-°" as he ripped open the foil covering fresh, crispy roti served with condensed milk. I was worried the condensed milk was accidentally excluded, but it was added inside and tasted great. 

Though the meat in Alex's pad gra prow wasn't prepared the way he hoped (he thought it would be minced and didn't check the description in the menu lol), he quickly devoured his dish. The pork was flavorful.

I ordered red curry with sweet potatoes and chicken, but was reluctant to try it because of my last experience at a different restaurant. I ended up being very happy about my choice as I had discovered a rich, flavorful curry that may be my new favorite around this part of the city. The spiciness has helped with my sinuses. I'd definitely eat here again.
author: Anna S.

description: I took my mom here for early Mother's Day lunch since I have to work on Mother's Day lol . The food was not bad , I had better but good enough. We enjoyed their papaya salad though. My mom loves  papaya salad and sometime she crave it so I will bring her here and it's close to her home .  Service , it's okay but she was nice at the end and said thank you and bye so that counts lol .
author: Miok C.

description: We had affordable lunches from their lunch menu.  We were with a 2 year old and they accommodated that well.  The food was fine and service was very good.  We will try it again if we are in the neighborhood.
author: roy c.

description: Went to Tawan's right after school one day because I was craving cheap but delicious Thai food, and let me tell ya...Tawan's did NOT disappoint.
author: Kiana M.

description: This is what San Francisco Thai food is all about, the delivery was fast and the food got here hot. Veggies are super fresh and still had a crisp (not soggy overcooked) taste. The Tom Kha Gai soup is so nearly perfect it will probably keep me healthy all winter. Spicy IS spicy at Tawan's, and thank you for that. This is exactly what we all needed to get us revved up for the holiday weekend. I will definitely be returning for some more of these divine flavors. Time to settle down for a long winter's nap!
author: dave p.

description: I walk by this place everyday and finally gave in to trying it! My biggest complaint was that the seafood curry was served on a plate, making it harder to scoop. Other than that it was very flavorful and had nice heat. The pad Thai wasn't super fancy but overall there was nothing to complain about!
author: Dylan H.

description:
The food here has okay Thai food. The seating capacity is pretty small, but this place in all honesty is nothing major.
The service from the staff is okay, not much of checking up to see if you need anymore water or if all is okay with the food, however, the staff are at least nice. 
This place is hardly ever packed, there is street-metered parking, or parking within the residential areas near the restaurant. 
Give this place a try, it is not bad, but just a "okay" place.
author: Stacey M.

description: One of my favorite places to eat. I love the Pad Ped, it is a rich coconut curry sauce and Eggplant and your choice of meats or Tofu. I always substitute the Eggplant for Broccoli since I am allergic to Eggplant. They are always very accommodating when I ask to substitute. The pad Kee Mao ( spicy noodles ) are amazing too. I always take my friends there. Always A+
author: Jerry A.

description: Totally cute, hole in the wall place with some authentic Thai food goin' on!  Every single thing I've ordered has been amazing.  I like medium spicy food and I have to order mild here, as they do it spiceeee!  Green curry, red curry with salmon, pad kee mao are some of my regular go-to dishes.  A total hidden gem on Geary Blvd. Not to be missed if you're a Thai food lover.
author: Kim W.

description: Given the fact this place has good reviews, I'm not sure what happened. I ordered delivery from GrubHub, the pad thai and "game hen." Both plates very disgusting. Quite literally the worst delivery I have ever had, I actually had to spit out the food.
author: Jason C.

description:
This is such a intimate and very cozy spot located in the inner Richmond. Local gem and the portions are fair for the price you pay. This place only has a few tables, so do come early if you have a big group. If not, it'd be a perfect place to go for a party of 4 or less. This is family owned so expect to see a lot of their family history within their menu. It's really cute how  they incorporate their son's artwork in the menu to go with it. 

I ordered the beef pad see ew and it was very flavorful and a good sized portion for the price. Everything was cooked well, the flavors blended beautifully. Would definitely come back again. The Thai tea was good although I do prefer less milk next time since they definitely put in more than usual for my serving.
author: Serena C.

description: Great Thai food. Had papaya salad (spicy), pumpkin curry and pork with basil. All had great flavor. Price was reasonable as well about $40 for 3 dishes and rice
author: James P.

description: I eat a lot of Thai food and have traveled to Thailand many times and found the food here to be very flavorful and bold.  "Thai" spicy which I love!  The papaya salad was amazing and seasoned perfectly (right amount of spicy and sweet)!  The sliced pork with chili and basil was fantastic and the pumpkin curry was great.  Fantastic Thai meal at a great price! Would definitely eat here again!
author: Vince G.

description:
Well, then, it's 8 PM and I'm not jet lagged but starving like I'm on pacific time zone, which is a bit odd, considering I have expected to be crashing with my circadian rhythm all messed up. A bit of spaz, I parked at my favorite spot on 7th Ave, and T is waiting. Says to me, "Hello?!" A bit hesitant, I've been gone for a bit. I unload my stuff, and say back, "I need food." 8 PM Monday Inner Richmond is a ghost town, even quieter than Tokyo on a weekend day. Put on my new bright orange boots, and in my ever so vibrant wrap dress and sky blue lace stockings, I look like a colored rainbow bunny hopping on the street. T does not mind. "Want ramen?" T asks. I say, "No way in hell. I'm Japanese-food out, just returned from Tokyo, remember?. How about southeastern Asian food?"

We start to walk towards Clement on 7th until T stops me midway. "I think Thai Time is closed." T knows that's my favorite Thai place by Clement as of late. At that moment, I was indeed thinking about that restaurant. A bit disappointed, but still I continue walking. T makes a left on Geary, and there it it, another Thai place and it's actually open.  Brightly lit, with yellow walls and kid's drawing as wall art. 

I learn quickly that the restaurant is named after their son, a cute boy prominently displayed on the front page of the menu, with the parents / owners. I figure those art work, might be his. 

A hard working couple, likely immigrants, finally opened a family business for their child, and named the restaurant after him, the menu comes with a story. So adorable. Gotta love that.

I order spicy and sour noodle soup. I have been having a hankering for something way southern Asia than the northern Asia, which I had been at until a day ago. The noodle hit the spot. It took me instantly back to three years ago: it was a perfect summer night in Phuket, I was eating a bowl of Thai noodle soup by the beach, feet in the sand, alone, in a straw hat and bathing suit, I took my time sipping coconut juice out of a fresh coconut while pondered where life would take me next. 

But T interrupts my thoughts by asking me what else I want to eat. I have no idea. So T orders the curry vegetable with tofu, which is not what I have chosen but it is perhaps one of the better ones I've ever had. It's not too dense - even though it is made of coconut cream vs. milk. It's fragrant and filled with nice veggies which is a much better option than its curry meat cousins at 8 O'Clock in the evening. T knows what I like to eat and we like to eat similar things. Good dining partners are hard to find, you know?

There is only one other table filled with three young men, who have their photos taken by the restaurant staff, presumably the mother of Tawan. They look happy and are delighted with their dishes.

We sit side by side, eat, and look out to Geary. It's a bit of dead. It's dark. It's not a happening neighborhood, but the same could be said about the entire city of San Francisco on a Monday evening. No one goes out. It's part of the charm, one may say.

We finish the food quietly. I feel more like myself after the meal. It's exactly what the doctor ordered.

"Welcome home. Ms. V." T says.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Quite liked this place. We were hanging out with friends who live walking distance from this place and when we felt a little peckish we shopped for good Thai places around. The EAT24 app suggested these guys and so we dived into their menu and started ordering.

When I arrived at the place to pick up my order I had to wait a few minutes, but I was soon out the door again and on my way home...where we tore open the containers and shared a happy meal!

Here's what we ordered:

#70: Pad Thai
#35: Pumpkin Curry
#19. Som Tum Salad (that was nice an spicy!)
#31: Gaeng Daeng Curry (beef)

Really, I would order from these guys anytime again.
author: Uli B.

description:
Delivery experience:

The panaeng curry is AMAZING - the best I've ever had. Ordered medium and the kick was very subtle, but the spice combo was just wonderful...several layers deep. Wonderful; highly recommended.
Of note, you DO NOT get free rice with delivery, it seems.

The Pad Thai is bad. It's mostly flavorless...it was served piping hot, which was great, but the noodles and chicken just barely had anything to them. That's ok. Now I know to go for curries here, not the pad thai.

In-restaurant experience: 
Bang up cute little Thai place with some really good flavor and prices.  I got beef pad ped. It's red curry with coconut milk. Although it seems like 2 and 3 stars are the same, it's got just enough spice to make your tongue interested but not guzzle water. The prices are great because they include ride, so you can get a Thai lunch for under $10! Will definitely be back.
author: Chris S.

description: You have to have the calamari! Wonderful service, and great atmosphere. Highly recommend!
author: Felix N.

description:
It can be hard finding a decent Thai restaurant that delivers for lunch. Since my favorite Thai place only delivers for dinner, the roommate and I decided to try Tawan's. We ordered via GrubHub and got the following:

Pad thai (no peanuts) $9.95 - Very bland. And the noodles were kinda mushy and overcooked. 

Som tum salad (no peanuts) $8.95 - Another bland dish. It had some kick since we ordered it spicy, but it didn't have much of any other notes to balance it out.

Tom yum gung soup ($10.95) - Was spicy but not much else. I wanted that mixture of sour, sweet, savory and spicy, but this was another dish that was just bland.

Gaeng ga-ree gai curry ($8.95) - This dish was okay. The curry was a little runny, but at least it had some flavor.

Pumpkin curry ($8.95) - The best dish! I normally never order pumpkin curry since I don't like pumpkin, but this had all the flavors a good curry should have. A little lighter in consistency, but great flavor.

Steamed brown rice ($2) and Steamed jasmine rice ($1.50) - I ordered the brown rice for my curry. The rice was kinda mushy for my taste but you have to have rice with curry right?!

So a really meh experience. Unless I want pumpkin curry, I probably won't be ordering from them again.
author: Elena N.

description:
16.08.20        one of  under a dozen visits

Food ------------------------ 4   Very good 

Straight to the point ....

     Thai food cooked perfectly
     No over cooked proteins
     Sauces are rich ... they factored in 
              the veggies' bleeding into the sauce (cause of watery sauces)
                     hate that alot.
     Portion is good.
     Do offer some unique dishes.

Words will not do this place justice.
A favorite thai place for me ... solid no nonsense thai.
See for yourself... in the past I said
    Ascault Bakery
    Marla
    Ro Cafe (Kurdish and other well made food)
    Italian Homemade Company
    Ty Sandwich

Another underdog that is or was under the radar.
Food is a personal taste aka opinion ...
Sometimes I bet me and other reviewers regret pointing out 
      hidden gems ... now I have to visit some places less often 
        because explosive popularity ... in another word ...
        The Secret is Out
        but, if you want them to survive we have to sometimes do the shoutout 
            before the rising rent and cost  chokes the buisness out
                  like most in SF ... 

Hey ... try it out
author: S.K. Y.

description: Honestly a bit surprised that there wasn't much traffic when I came. Had a lot of the Thai staples like curry and tom yum, tasted perfectly fine. Dessert I had the fried banana ice cream, tasted great too. Would not mind coming back.
author: Eddie W.

description:
Food was great, but let me warn you, spicy means spicy here!

My wife and I love spicy food, and she ordered her food "hot" and me "very spicy."  Well, we wish it would have been medium and hot, respectively.

Still, food was great, and waitress kept our waters filled to accommodate. 

Would come again!
author: Mark M.

description:
It's been a while since I've written a review. I ordered pick up from Tawan via Grubhub. Two items, a fish dish and mango sticky rice. My estimated time for pick up with roughly 20 minutes. So far so good. I arrive at the restaurant about 25 minutes later and I walk in asking for pick up. The lady at the counter is scrambling around and finally finds my order. She told me that they are out of the mango sticky rice (thanks for the heads up). 

So I said fine, I'll have some steamed rice. Then she tries to push appetizers, desserts, drinks, and more rice on to me. I politely refused. A couple minutes later she comes back and says are you sure? Why not some roti? Some Thai iced tea? Again, I said no thanks. One minute later, she asks AGAIN, and I said look, can I just get the difference between the mango sticky rice and the regular steamed rice? She said no. It's not possible. I have to contact Grubhub. So I told her fine, I'll call when I get home, I'm sure it's an easy fix. 

About 5 minutes passes by, she comes over and ask me if I had called Grubhub? I told her I will call her when I get home. It's a little loud in here. Another 10 minutes goes by, I ask her where is my food? She told me the kitchen had JUST started cooking it. She told me that her "system" was not working and the order "just came in." Even though I had been waiting at the restaurant waiting for nearly 20 minutes. 

Finally, after 10 more minutes, the food was ready. The whole ordeal took over an hour. But hey, at least I have my food now and I can enjoy some delicious Thai food that Yelp is raving about. I get home, open my food, and there are hair follicles CRUSTED on my fish. 

This restaurant was not equipped to handle the amount of traffic on a Monday evening. There were dirty dishes on tables waiting to be cleared off. The kitchen could not output the food in a timely manner (although one hour for something that takes less than 10 minutes to cook is ridiculous). The cooks handling the food did not wear proper sanitary equipment. 

Overall, this was a complete and utter waste of 1.5 hours for me. Do yourself a favor, skip this one. There are plenty of Thai restaurants in the city with much better customer service and sanitary conditions.
author: Frank X.

description: Food came cold. Everything SUCKED. The choo Chee curry had good flavor but it was so runny and there was hardly any meat or vegetables in it AT ALL. The steamed rice tasted old, the wings only came with 4 pieces and had just an ok flavor, and the pad Thai was so sour. We also got fried tofu which came delivered VERY cold. The delivery guy also demanded a tip when I had already tipped on my credit card when I made the order. I will never order from this restaurant again and I suggest you never do as well. What a waste of $50.
author: Michael A T.

description:
It frustrates me that so many bad reviews on here are about Eat24's poor delivery system. It's unfair to Tawan's as they serve delicious Thai food! I always pick-up and their service is prompt, friendly, and the food is hot and perfectly packaged. 

Tips:
-Pad see yew and panang curry are my faves!  
-Tom yum soup is pretty good
-I prefer their pork and beef over their chicken
-For those who are not used to Thai spicy, "medium" spicy is pretty spicy 

I haven't had much luck finding really good Thai food in SF, but I think this is one of the best out here! So happy it's close enough to be my neighborhood spot (seriously, I get it once a week). Highly recommend!
author: Grace T.

description: Ok so I thought it was good at first because we had a larger group and the worker greeted us and made us feel welcomed and moved the tables so we could sit together. We ordered our food and everything and then we got the food and the taste did not match the prices. The pad thaii was very runny and was too strong, then we got our check and she overcharged us. Not only, was the food not great but we definitely were unsatisfied with the service. Definitely don't recommend this place unless you like getting sick or you like egg rolls and Thai tea.
author: Sophia A.

description: One of the best Thai places I've had in a long time. The staff is very friendly, we even got a picture with the chef! We got the the Pad See Ew beef and Penang Curry beef. The Pad See Ew was very flavorful and the Penang Curry beef had just the right spice on it. The place has a good amount of seating for the size of the location. Would definitely recommend!
author: Tom L.

description:
This review is for delivery on a Friday night. 

8:06pm: Order placed on Eat24
8:08pm: Called restaurant to confirm order (they got it) 
9:36pm: Eat24 app notification time of when I would get my food
9:51pm: Called restaurant to ask about my food. She said the delivery should be on the way because they close at 10pm so the last delivery went out. 
10:07pm: Food is finally delivered 


2 hours for delivery (0.5 miles away). Ridiculous. On top of that, the curry I ordered looks like leftovers. Looks nothing like the other curry deliveries that other yelpers posted. Probably because if they had put it in a soup container (like normal), it would not look like a full order. But guess what, this container also doesn't look like a full order.  This order was definitely not worth $10.95. 

Food does taste good though so maybe eat at the restaurant and don't order delivery.
author: Carmen C.

description:
AVOID. There are so many other thai places in SF, just do yourself a favor and don't.

Echoing the previous reviewer, I've had a horrible, horrible experience at this place. They're incompetent, dishonest, and the food is not even that good. If you're all the way out here, just go to Amphawa or Thai Time. Avoid this place at all costs.
author: Nami S.

description: Best Thai food ever. A have to try for anyone visiting San Francisco. Very authentic did served here, definitely one of the best in sf.
author: Henry N.

description:
If i could put 0 starts i would! 
This place has the worst service and attitude!
The dishes are dirty, the chicken comes with bones and even if you say mild it will be spicy. 
They refuse to change your order even if there are serious problems with it! 
DO NOT GO/ ORDER FROM THIS PLACE!
author: Yana A.

description:
I found this to be delicious Thai home cooking, with some quirks in my experience. I asked for them to omit bell peppers from the Penang Beef so they omitted all vegetables, which was an undesirable outcome! The delivery time was too damn long, by far. 105 minutes for a place that's 15 minutes away by car? Does their delivery guy take the bus? But the food was fresh, extremely hot and spicy the way I ordered it, and I felt they use quality ingredients. That counts for a lot in my book. So I'll definitely try this place again, but perhaps call in my order by phone instead of placing an order online. 
For that matter I am beginning to think that online food ordering is almost always a mistake. How terrible is it anyway to talk to someone, that we have to use the internet?
author: Steven P.

description:
I stopped by this place for lunch. It's a small neat Thai bistro that offers a lunch menu along with their full menu. There are only a few tables but fortunately it wasn't busy when I stopped by.

I had the Gaeng Daeng Curry with pork. I asked for spicy and it was, but not as crazy hot as I was hoping. My tolerance for spice is very high so it's to be expected. The flavor was good, very savory. My complaints would be that the portion of rice and pork were lacking. Thai curries are pretty watery so its easy to go through rice in a hurry. I'm used to places skimping on beef since its expensive but pork and chicken are fairly cheap so i was a little disappointed with the amount of pork in my curry.

I plan on coming back. Possibly for dinner with some friends so we can try out more dishes.
author: aaron t.

description: This is a total personal preference. I like Thai food with less lime. I like a burst of lime favor, but this was just overwehlming for me and gave me heartburn.
author: Rayannah S.

description: Ate lunch at this neigborhood cafe. Metered parking. Cafe has 6 tables for four. Food was tasty and good service too. Thai food taste like home cooking Thai style.
author: Clifford W.

description:
This place has great a Thai takeout menu. From the time you place your order until delivery, it's like no more than 20 some minutes. Ok, that is if you live in the area, but you get what I am talking about. 

Every dish I have gotten from there has been spot on. It's comes hot, fresh and delish. The prices are very reasonable for the area, and for what you get. They also provide you all the utensils and stuff, down to the plates. That's always nice when it comes to delivery, and you don't want much clean up after! 

If you want good Thai delivery, and live in the area, I definitely suggest this place. You will not be disappointed.
author: Sonia A.

description:
The place is very small. Service is very friendly. 
We ate at this restaurant maybe twice, but we ordered delivery from here .... A LOT!! Very dependable, reliable service. Sometimes they messed up the spiciness, so now I always ordered not spicy, and the spicy sauce on the side... our fave are the pad Thai and the pumpkin curry. 
the delivery gentleman is so polite, he always says " please enjoy your dinner!" .
author: lovetoeat a.

description:
Menu, music, decor had flavor.
So why didn't my food?

Pictures included a rapter [sic].
So why didn't the t-shirts?

Not 3 stars, but not 2 stars.
Peace out, Tawan & fam.
author: Dan B.

description: I ordered online and was pretty disappointed. Both curries were pretty much all sauce and they hardly added any meat. The pad Thai was pretty barren of meet as well and didn't taste that great anyways. Thought I'd give them a try but there's plenty of other Thai places in SF to choose from.
author: Laef B.

description:
Pretty decent entrees, we split three among four of us.  The waitress was super nice and let us split the check four ways.  

Definitely on par with other Thai restaurants in the area like MyThai. Prices are not bad at all.

Not much seating and it is a little hole in the wall, but perfect for a Friday girls' night.
author: Meaghan H.

description: I've been going to this place a couple of times a month for 7 years. Not because the food is great - it is adequate - but because they are less than a block away. My takeout order tonight of crab friend rice and crab cakes. Two go-to's. I got home, opened the crab cakes, went to grab one and *squish*. So oily it ran off the crab cake when I touched it. Gross! Ok, NBD, mistakes happen, so I took it right back. They refused to give me my money back. I've been going to this joint for seven years! I've never sent food back. I've never been anything but a gracious, well tipping neighbor. But they didn't care. I left the crab cakes. They weren't edible. I really have no patience for a business who will lose a neighborhood customer over some $7 dollar oil patties. Shame on you.
author: christine m.

description:
I've been coming here for 15 years and the place still never fails. 
Special Pumpkin Tom Khar soup with shrimp. 

Boom!
author: ryan s.

description: Took over 2 hours to get delivered. We're actually still waiting. I don't care if they have the greatest Thai food I've ever tasted, the service is completely unacceptable.
author: Kevin O.

description: Good food but if you live 4 blocks away it took them about. Over 45 mins to get to my house.
author: Seaera T.

description: I'm speechless. It took two hours and twenty minutes for my order of 5 items to be delivered, I live two blocks away. After waiting one and a half hours, called the restaurant and was told "sorry, but we have customers". I'm not exactly sure how I am not a customer. Needless to say, they have lost my business indefinitely.
author: Leslie F.

description: I wanted to like this place because of the cute awning with the child's drawing on the front.  However, I ordered online from this place at around 4PM using Eat24 and the meal didn't arrive until way after 1 hour (estimated arrival time was 45-60 mins).  I ordered Pad See-Ew and Khao Pad Talay (a fried rice) and both were pretty flavorless.  Portions were decent for the price, but I won't be ordering from them again.
author: Cat C.

description: Tried two types of curry here last night...both delicious. If I'm in the area again and want Thai, I would come back for sure.
author: Gina G.

description:
I have never eaten in the restaurant, but have ordered delivery quite a few times. The food is excellent!
I love the papaya salad, it's crunchy and fresh, a nice counterpart to the other textures of the meal. The pumpkin curry with chicken and extra vegetables is my favorite dish year round - bid, slightly sweet chunks of Thai pumpkin are a treat.

Delivery is always prompt, friendly and accurate.
author: Carole B.

description: They let me call in a pick up order RIGHT as they were closing, completely kind and accommodating.  Food was so yummy and seriously the service can't be beat.  Can we comment on the adorbs kids art on the wall too.  Tawan I heart you.
author: Melissa H.

description: Very, very meh quality Thai food. My Tom Khar Gai soup was only 3/4 of a container full and full of onions. Pad Thai looked like a kid's meal with 3 sad looking shrimps and very dry pieces of chewy tofu. Goong Gra-Borg had 5 pieces of super dried out shrimp. Definitely not worth the money. There are tons of great Thai restaurants in the Richmond and now I'll know which one I will avoid.
author: Laurie P.

description: I have been going to Tawan for Thai food cravings for about three years now. The service was always great, and the food is delicious. Well, up until now. I've got to say that my service there was horrible today. My coworker and I wanted to order take out. We called in and had them faxed over the lunch menu. My friend ordered her Pad Thai $8.95 and I ordered Tom Khar Gai soup which was $4.95 on the menu that they faxed over.  When I got there the cashier person handed me the bill in which they charged me $9.95. Wait a minute, hold up. What happened there?!! They say they charge  extra for soup if you don't drink it there. I told the cashier that it's pretty rude not tell the customer about the ''hidden cost''. A caution to those who order to go.
author: Katie T.

description: Best Thai food in the city. Seriously great. Always consistent, and the more Thai I have in SF, the more I want to only eat here.
author: Tyler M.

description:
Incredibly friendly and warm staff. This is a wonderful hole in the wall and they even deliver!

the most authentic sticky rice with mango I have found in NorCal. 

Could eat here every night. Gotta love that pad see ew.
author: Natalie K.

description:
So have tried this place twice. First time, I really enjoyed it. But the second time...I got food poisoning! Super shitty ): 
Maybe just a fluke, but I will not be risking it again.
author: Chelsey G.

description: I'm so angry right now. I ordered delivery from Tawan's through Eat24. It said that the order went through and it would be 45-60 minutes until it arrived. 1 hour and 45 minutes later I called to ask what had happened to my order "oh sorry we're too busy we won't be able to fill your order." WTF. I asked the woman why she didn't call me to tell me it wasn't coming or at the very least cancel the order. "We were too busy." was her answer. So now it's 10:00pm and I've got no dinner...joy. Thanks Eat24 and Tawan's!
author: Beth S.

description:
A small hole in the wall but a treasure to find!  
Great service, very small but quaint atmosphere, delicious food!  
Ordered the Drunken Noodles with chicken (Pad Kee Moa), the noodle texture was great!  Soft and pillowy, tender and flavorful!  The noodles had just the right amount of spice and sauce!
Worth the venture into this side of the city!
author: Dana B.

description: My friend and I came here  for late lunch and ordered vegetarian satay, tofu red pumpkin curry, vegetarian pad Thai, young coconut, and tea. The curry (mod. spicy) with brown rice was delicious, although not hard to find at other Thai restaurants. We were happy that they had young Thai coconut, which is not always available in grocery stores and restaurants. They also offer to refill your cup of hot tea. The pad Thai was just okay. Pad Thai at other Thai restaurants were better. The tofu satay with peanut sauce was bland so we asked for some chili sauce, which they carried. What really disappointed us most of all was this behavior of the waitress upon receiving our payment. We paid in cash with a tip, she asked if we needed change and my friend said no, then she gathered the bills and right there on our table she lifted the paper bills against the sunlight to see if they were real, and it wasn't even a quick discreet look! Rude!
author: Sherrie V.

description:
I love Tawan's Thai food. It's a great neighborhood restaurant with delicious food. Have dined in and ordered take out and delivery many times. Food is always piping hot and made the way I like it. 

Must order: pumpkin curry! Chock full of vegetables. Hearty and filling.

Staff is very nice. Restaurant is tiny. Food is authentic. I would like to keep this mom and pop shop in business! Check this place out.
author: Stine H.

description:
I just had lunch here yesterday.  It's a smallish restaurant that probably seats 24 at full capacity.  It appears to be a family run establishment.  The waitress who was preparing green beans in a back table stopped, greeted me and offered me a seat and a menu.  I picked out a noodle dish right away, but I pondered among the appetizers menu until one caught my eye and shouted back at me.  It had BACON and shrimp and it was deep fried!  

I loved the embroidered table cloth which had a design featuring the seven legged "Squidy", but the food arrived too quickly for me to take a photo of it.  Goong Gra-Borg is a rather simple appetizer pairing a tail-on shrimp and a piece of fatty bacon side by side, wrapping both together in an egg roll wrapper and deep frying it to golden perfection.  Served with some shaved carrots and a sweet and sour sauce that was neither too sweet nor too sour this appetizer is meant to be eaten hot from the fryer while the flavors of shrimp and the bacon are still sizzling.  

My noodle dish arrived almost simultaneously with the appetizer, but I'm so glad I chose to eat the fried dish first.  The amount of gravy was a bit overwhelming on the Chicken Lard-Nar noodle dish, but I liked the vibrant green of the two types of broccoli and it appeared that all of the chicken meat was skinless chicken breasts.  The clump of pan-fried rice noodles sat in the center of the dish buried beneath the chicken and the broccoli.  Some of the noodles were a bit charred, but the dish was nicely seasoned and the gravy wasn't as sweet as I had feared.

It was a filling lunch, and I'm sure I'll be back one day to tried some more items on their menu.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: The food is delicious and the people working here are really pleasant. I come here often on my lunch breaks.
author: Mila L.

description: I'm easily satisfied by Thai food, so...take this review with a grain of salt. That said, I like the way they prepare the Pad Thai noodle. The yellow curry here is always excellent. And there is one appetizer - Meang Khum - which is just an extraordinary mix of ingredients and flavors. We order from Tawan's on a regular basis for delivery in the I.R.
author: Morris R.

description: SF could use more good Thai places and this isn't one of them. Ordered 3 things for delivery and all were pretty bad. Pad Thai was way way way over cooked; veggie peanut sauce was was too watery and flavorless, and the bbq pork was....gamey? Yeah, it was actually gamey. We didn't finish any of our entrees. Nasty.
author: Byrne B.

description:
My standard for judging a Thai restaurant has always been the pad thai with the maximal spice option, and this place did not really do the trick.

After a long day at work I decided to do a delivery order, which meant I had to get something else besides my pad thai to hit the $18 minimum. I decided on the spring rolls as my add-on, which was pretty good but nothing to rave about. The sauce it came with unfortunately was not a traditional peanut sauce that I was expecting, rather it was quite tangy.

Onto the pad thai... Well, I've honestly tasted nothing like it before, and that's not necessarily a good thing. It was kind of sweet, and had a hint of coconut which usually does not belong in the pad thai flavor group. The top layer was spicy as I asked, but mostly because it had a heavy layering of red pepper flakes : /

Probably won't order from here again, but I will note that the man who delivered my food was extremely kind.
author: Jenn L.

description:
A small clean, well-decorated Thai restaurant in Inner Richmond area. We checked out this place for dinner. We tried the following :-
1) Pad Sub Nok with Ground Chicken - Was tasty. Bean were slightly undercooked though
2) Drunken Noodles [Pad Kee-Mao?] with Tofu - was awesome.
3) Yellow Curry with /chicken - Best Yellow curry I have ever had.
4) Red curry with Tofu - was average.
5) Thai Iced tea - Good.
author: Mia C.

description: One of my favorite Thai places in the Bay area! Highly recommend the Pad Ped Tofu.
author: Jason S.

description: I had to find a new thai place after the one near me closed down. The only thing I order from here is Pad see ew and the curry! I think that the cute drawings and dedication to their son is cute.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Nice little fresh feeling mellow and cute restaurant  with 5 tables and friendly service. The food was not amazing though; it was good but I won't be back any time too soon. 

The price to happiness ratio was a little high.
author: Justin S.

description:
Oh no!  Food poisoning!  I had a very...uncomfortable...awakening after eating here for dinner.  

Also, we specified on our online order "no meat" and "no soy" in all the dishes, since my friend is vegetarian and highly allergic to soy (I know, I know. I think she eats a lot of beans). The pad thai had tofu in it...Um, isn't tofu made of soy??? She couldn't eat any of it. Then I had my unfortunate experience around 2 am, and had to throw away all the leftovers.  

I would give one star, but the food tasted good (on the way down...) and my friend has been there many times before and never had a problem. They seem really nice, but need to meet the basics of food prep.
author: Jackie M.

description:
Worst experience.  

Order around 9:30 Saturday, ask for Tom Yum soup with shrimp but don't hit delivery minimum so ask for some sort of mixed veggie dish with garlic (pretty basic stuff).  At first she thinks I'm saying "satay" not sautéed, so we go around for awhile until she understands my order and asks if I want rice with my veggies (I decline but point is she gets what i'm trying to order).  After quite some time I get a call saying it's taking longer than expected but the food is on its way.  Food arrives, driver leaves, and I quickly discover I got soup and tofu satays (huh..?)  I call and after much back and forth am told there is nothing they can do since they are closed.  They offer to credit me but I say I would prefer the driver to come back and refund me the cash I paid him.  NOW they offer to re-make the correct dish and send it to me. Ok fine I say.

Fast forward 20 minutes... at this point I've given the tofu sticks (which were dry and awful) to my roomies awaiting my veggies and the doorbell rings.  The driver hands me my food and demands the other dish back.  Um... I gave them to my roommates I explain, and he tells me that he'll have to charge me for the new dish in that case.  Are you kidding me???  I refuse and tell him if the restaurant has an issue to call me.  He gives me a hard time for another few minutes and finally leaves.  

I finally have my food now.  We've established the tofu satays were pretty gross. Veggies are fairly tasty but an extremely small portion.  Soup is bad.  REAL BAD.  Its sweet to the point its actually seems like sugar was dumped straight in, and the shrimp was the driest, most overcooked, crumbliest, nastiest shrimp I've ever had.  biggest waste of 11 dollars ever.   Won't be back.
author: Alicia B.

description:
My favorite Thai place in the city. 

If you're looking to test eating spicy Thai food, this place is great! They're not kidding around with their "extra spicy" option. I can generally handle spicy foods with minimal problems usually, but I was almost crying over my [extra sour, extra spicy] Tom Yum soup . The Tom Khar Gai Soup oh so good and I'm pretty sure I'd order this over the Tom Yum.

Tip: Ask them to put the pepper on the side so you can adjust the spice level yourself.

Their yellow curry is great! I rarely order yellow curries because I don't do mild curries. Tawan's yellow curry kind of perfect because it's just enough of a kick to keep me interested.

I like going here better than ordering delivery. While delivery is convenient, it sometimes takes a long time because there's only one person cooking and one person doing deliveries. Plus all the cute drawings from Tawan and family feel makes me feel all warm and fuzzy.
author: Annie Y.

description: It took 2 hours to get our dinner! I had better. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.
author: Vii P.

description: Small restaurant so I've resorted to delivery only from this place. Good food -- green and red curries are solid. The pineapple fried rice with seafood is yummy -- I like squid and they've got it. Definitely a fan... except I passed by their store the other day and it said there was a family thing (illness? i forget.) and they're closed for now with no return date.
author: Vicki T.

description: Beyond disappointed. ordered via eat24 at 815pm, it said it should arrive at 915pm. When i called at 945pm the lady said they were not making our order because their "too busy" and they were too busy to call me to tell me my order was canceled. How can you run a business like this?
author: Richard S.

description: This is my to go Thai place for delivery.  I always order the eggplant with tofu in a basil sauce and and the vegetarian tom yum soup.  It's always so flavorful with such great aromas that my mouth starts to water before I can devour my food in one sitting.  I ask for my dish without thickening sauce and added sugar and I can definitely say they always adhere to my complicated request.  The fresh basil mixed with all the right spices , the crunchy bamboo shoots and the eggplant cooked to perfection.  Once I'm done with the eggplants I move onto my tom yum soup which is extremely refreshing and spicy. There's so many healthy vegetables in the soup like broccoli, tomatoes, mushrooms mixed with a hint of lemongrass and ohhh it relaxes and fulfill my lazy night in.  I'm impatient when it comes to food and I've never had to wait for more than 40 minutes for my spicy and amazing Thai food delivery.
author: Sharon N.

description:
What attracted me was the cuteness and simplicity of the place. The drawings on the menu are just so adorable! I was craving noodles and got my standard, pad thai. It was overwhelmingly sweet. I know that sugar is part of the recipe, but there was hardly any sourness to balance it. The noodles were cooked perfectly, though. Hardly any bean sprouts or green onion, so the mass was mostly noodles, little tofu pieces and 4 shrimp. I left feeling like I already had dessert. 

Customer service was fine and I had my water glass readily refilled. However, as a frequent solo diner, my advice to any host/hostess is to say "Table for one?" instead of "Are you alone?" Yes, they technically mean the same thing, but the latter puts the diner in a defensive position.
author: Theresa S.

description:
I came here for lunch, and they offered $8-$9 lunch specials including curries, soups, rice dishes, and noodle dishes.

PAD THAI: The reviews here were mixed, but I was really craving it. The flavors were almost there, but not quite. It lacked the appropriate sweetness/saltiness. The noodles were the right size, but they were all broken up.

GREEN CURRY: Typical green curry - good, but not amazing nor terrible. I got it "mild" (you can choose between not spicy, mild, and spicy). The Mild was the perfect amount of spicy-ness (and I love spicy!). 

The damage? $20 for 2 people, not bad for lunch especially given the portion size. But next time I might stick with the Pad See Ew.
author: Jess C.

description: Always get delivery from here and Love the Pumpkin curry!  Great food and quick.  Fair pricing and not fake or lame Thai knock off food!
author: Andrew S.

description:
You know when you're in a boring lecture and you start doodling random things in the columns of your notebook? Well then, any restaurant that promotes doodling is good in my book!

Tawan's is a yummy, affordable Thai restaurant, made even cooler by the fact that the menu is full of hand-drawn pictures! LOVE. IT. There's even a blurb in the front about Tawan, complete with awkward school photos and an awesome stick figure drawing!

Drawings = A+
Food = AAAwesomeee

My friends got pad thai and pumpkin curry, while I got Guay-Tiaw Gra-Praow (ground chicken with chili, onion, bell pepper, and basil served over rice noodles). Everything was tasty and the portions are generous. Definitely worth the price! I'd have to say the majority of the entrees are less than $10! :)

This restaurant just makes me feel so happy! Of course I'm coming back! Who doesn't love yellow walls, doodles, and cheap delicious Thai food?!
author: Kei H.

description: These guys don't even deserve ONE star.  We placed an order through Eat24.  I had visitors and waiting for the food.  I finally called hour and a half later.  Non one picked up the call.  I called 4 times.  Finally, a person picks up the phone and let me know that they didn't even process the order.  They were busy.  They didn't even have the courtesy to let me know that they can't do it.  I waited up until 10:10 pm.  And now All the restaurants were closed.  They didn't even apologies.  This place should SHUT DOWN  HORRIBLE SERVICE,  THET DONT CARE ABOUT SERVICE.
author: Petek U.

description:
Crab fried rice!!! Booooom

I mean it, you have to try the crab fried rice. It's out of this world. 

I don't venture into inner Richmond too often but I'm gonna start coming to this place fairly often.
author: Abhi M.

description:
Child's play.

Named after their kid: http://theeatenpath.com/2010/10/14/tawans-thai-food-san-francisco-ca/

Followed because of their food: Average of four stars after almost 300 reviews.

Can see why from things like the Som Tum salad. Mango ($1 more), dried shrimp and veggies and crushed peanut in a lime dressing. Sweet and satisfying.

Grilled white meat chicken satay was OK. Four skewers of poultry provided a nice balance to all the seafood, but was a bit dry.

Less impressive was the Pad Makheur Yao. Sauteed shrimp, eggplant and bell pepper have so much potential. Really needed more seafood and less oil.

Friendly service and endearing family run nature were both positives, but couldn't help but feel the bill was a bit more expensive ($35 with rice included) than deserved.

Wish the kid well. Wish there were more stars to give his namesake.
author: Jason B.

description:
How great! What a cozy joint! The menu is very unique, it's much like a child's book. Personal and friendly service every time I've been there. I recommend this place to friends.

Green curry was very spicy. 
Pad thai is good. 
Parking is not too hard
author: Veranna N.

description:
First off: the menu is UBER CUTE! I found myself so distracted looking at all the cute drawings by their kid, which include funny and somewhat embarassing kiddo pics too! I'd be so mad if my mom posted those pics of me! haha! 

After checking out all the drawings, we decided to try the Pad See Ew, Pra-Rama Long-Song (chicken with peanut sauce and vegigies) and one order of their chicken wings with sweet chili sauce and another order with red curry. Everything was pretty good, with the chicken wings being the stand out dish. Be warned, there are only 5 wings in each order, so if you plow through wings, order a lot! 

The service was attentive and the prices were reasonable too. I'd definitely be back, especially for those wings! mmmmm. wings.
author: Marie S.

description: This place is really something.....service is not bad. but the food....omg, i think the chef comes out and peek at who orders the food then they know what portion size to cook. lol.  I was there with 2 other girls, one guy, and a 3 year old. Our pad thai was not from the lunch menu list....and it was so dam small...we looked over the other table, they ordered the same dish but the amount was doubled! All of our dishes, the portion size is almost the size of our fist....wth?  As we were leaving, we looked at another table with 5 adults, and all of their portion size was huge!! I don't understand how they determine the amount of food to make for each plate.....if you have a small appetite or if your not that hungry, then come here an waste your money. If not, then go else where please!!!
author: Alyce l.

description: My family is Thai and we hands down love the food at this restaurant. They use fresh spices and offer a few authentic dishes that are not normally found in regular Thai restaurant menus.
author: SJ B.

description:
The food do taste better than other mediocre thai restaurant, however, their service is horrendous!!  I called to get a noodle soup (Yen Ta Fo) togo.  The man who answered the phone sounded so grumpy when answering the phone.  He picked up the phone and said, "Thai Food!".  I didn't hear him and wanted to make sure I called the right place so I asked, "Is this Tawan?"  He grumpily yelled, "Tawan is Thai Food!"
Then, he handed the phone to a girl who spoke English.

When I picked up my togo order, it was $9.70. I had extra change and wanted to give them 6 dimes and 10 pennies.  I told the girl that I wanted to use my change because it was weighing down my clutch.  Then she said they DON'T TAKE PENNIES!  Okay??? So I asked how do they not since they need change to give back to their customers.  I couldn't believe it!  

After I angrily walked out of the door, I had realized they had packed my noodles + soup in the same container!  WHO DOES THAT??? It takes 20-25 minutes to get home, and they couldn't pack them separately?  Did they think I was stupid to not realized the noodles were going to expand and leave me with no soup.  I was frustrated, but I was starved.  Hence, I did not mind eating in my car.  BUT they didn't pack me utensils!  What's this????  

I am unsure if I want to support this type of business again.  Again, pretty good food, but HORRIBLE service!!
author: MT D.

description: It's a little pricey considering the portion size and quality, and I found eggshells in my Pad See-Ew. Gross.
author: Erik B.

description:
Review based on delivery experience:

To start, the ordering process was very easy - the woman on the phone was very nice and made sure to review my order to make sure everything was correct.  Took about 30 minutes for the food to get delivered.  The panang curry was great and the pad thai was some of the best I've ever had.  Just a warning: their spicy really does mean spicy.

Overall, would come here or order delivery again!
author: David S.

description: The eggplant with pepper, onion, and garlic dish was great - aromatic, perfect texture of eggplant without too much oil absorbed. Pumpkin curry was decent with balanced sauce with a hint of coconut. Skip the larb as appetizer - the beef quality was disappointing.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
My boyfriend took me here as a plan B for Valentine's Day. Originally we were going to cook but he got off work late so we decided to eat out. Avoiding the popular v-day digs, we opted for a neighborhood joint hoping there would be no lines. Luckily when we arrived, there were two empty tables. I love eating Thai food from time to time and I'm not picky, but this place blew me away! Up to this point, Thai food I've had in SF is decent, but not great. I thought nothing could beat the $5 menu at King of Thai in North Beach-- until I came here.

We ordered the pumpkin curry with pork, and decided to be adventurous with two other dishes that we've never tried before: thung thong and larb-nar with beef. The curry was mild enough but had a good kick to it, without being too spicy. The spiciness also didn't mask the flavors of the ingredients and the coconut milk- very well balanced. Larb-nar is a great dish similar to pad see ew but in a light-colored gravy broth with plenty of greens. It seemed healthier than eating pad see ew, which is usually pan friend with LOTS of oil.

My favorite dish was the thung thong- a deep fried large wonton-ish thing filled with ground chicken and curried potatoes and carrots. I don't know why I never discovered this appetizer at other Thai restaurants! Even the leftover was scrumptious the next day after my boyfriend popped it in the toaster oven.

Everything we ordered was delicious and I am looking forward to coming back here to try other items on their menu. Besides the amazing food, another thing that makes this places stand out is the cute homey atmosphere. The good prices combined with the quality of the food, along with great service, earns this place a solid 5 stars in my book!
author: Melody C.

description:
The food was just okay to me but better than some places I've been to. Maybe I didn't order the right stuff. 

We had the Tom yum soup, beef satay, chicken satay, Thai fried rice, and combo sour noodle soup. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZX5XUU9z1nmoUyiuPtjSLg?select=Wn5fzqUQ7pZaUxJ8g28L-w The soup was quite enjoyable and not over-sweetened but I think it could use more lemongrass, galangal, and tamarind. Both satays were kind of tough. The beef one had really good flavor but was a pain to chew. The chicken was kind of on the dry side and didn't have much flavor besides the curry powder covering the outside. Fried rice was pretty good...flavors were well-balanced and the rice was soft but not mushy. The least enjoyable (actually I thought it was disgusting...) was the noodle soup. The broth was just...I don't know. It was like chicken broth mixed with a ladle of ketchup. The flavor and consistency was very unpalatable. The combination of ingredients were okay though the noodle does expand very quickly and it's difficult to try to eat it before it becomes a goopie goop.

Service was minimal (not rude) but fast. No smiling. No greeting. Just take your order then bring out your food. 

If you're I interested in handmade jewelries, Tawan have some for sale on their wall: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZX5XUU9z1nmoUyiuPtjSLg?select=L3ea-L2u4nEwwSygJjxQbg

Look! They got turtles!! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZX5XUU9z1nmoUyiuPtjSLg?select=seU8or9XowNJGVw9PMnBTw
author: Jennifer L.

description:
The place is small, but VERY cute. It seemed like a family owned business with a friendly waitress. We really enjoyed the food and found the medium to be just the right amount of caliente. I'm glad I didn't order the full spicy, I was tearing up with the medium and I like spicy. 

I however felt the prices were a little high for the portions.

Hopefully this review doesn't raise expectations beyond reason and result it subsequent mediocre reviews. All I ask is that the place be compared to other Thai restaurants. Bon appetite.
author: Roya J.

description:
Food is good, but the service is not. No wonder I always order to go in Thai restaurants. 'Cause most Thai people in the restaurant business lack customer service esp. Tawan's. I ordered the Pad Thai, Pumpkin Curry, and the Seafood fried rice. I forgot the thai names to them. Customer service is a huge part of my reviews so I had to knock it down to a 2.

+: The food was gooood! I loved everything. The pad thai is one of the best that I have ever had. The fried rice was yummmy! The pumpkin curry was goood! 

-: Portions are smaller than other Thai restaurants. So the pad thai came, then the curry came, and we were sitting there for like 10 minutes just looking at the curry and wondering "where the fuck is the fried rice at?". Then the waitress came out and said some shit that I do not remember and I asked her "where is the rice? did you forget to write it down?". She didn't even apologize, she kept on blaming me. She forgot to write down the seafood fried rice when I repeated it like 3 times and I pointed at it on the menu and saying "I want this", this bitch told me that I didn't say anything.  Then at the end it totaled everything up wrong and overcharged us.
author: Janet Z.

description:
This is the cutest, friendliest Thai place I know of! 

This family owned restaurant is decorated with art drawn by their son (Tawan) and boasts electric yellow and green walls! The menu is also hand-drawn and just so cute I want to keep it.

I also love this place because it is one of the few Thai places I've found that serve rotee; the fried flaky dough topped with sweetened condensed milk (if you haven't tried it before, you haven't lived). They also have friend banana ice cream which they lovingly refer to as "F.B.I."

Great service! Loads of charm! Good food, too!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Maybe it's because the wrapper on my straw came folded up into a little rose...or maybe it's because the restaurant is plastered all over with drawings by little Tawan (their son)...but I *heart* this cute little family run establishment.  The place is teeny tiny but on the weeknight we were there- they were bustling- cranking out to go orders.

I think I had the Pad Prik Sod- which turned out to be  fried chicken in a slightly tangy sweet and sour sauce.  The chicken was a bit over-fried and dry, I didn't care for it much...but my friend had the Green Bean and Chicken dish- Pad Sub Nok, and it was SUPER!

Rose:  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZX5XUU9z1nmoUyiuPtjSLg?userid=fQPX2QrnxmS35ALQmnnIsw
author: Judy K.

description:
Cute little Thai restaurant...small & comfy.

I ordered two items having colorful names:

(1) THUNG THONG: sorta like a samosa, except it has ground chicken and no peas or potatoes.  These were great

(2) PAD PRIK KHING: I got this dish with silced beef.

BONUS:  I got a parking space right out in front with a busted meter that read out-of-order.
author: Derek N.

description:
As other reviewers have noted, Tawan's is not a fine dining establishment.  If you are looking for high end cuisine, go elsewhere.  What Tawan's offers, however, is very tasty and reasonably priced Thai style food.  I have tried a number of different dishes from here, and I have not let been down yet.  This is a place I like to go at least twice per month, though I usually pick it up to go.

Atmosphere: The restaurant is very small, bright, and full of fun drawings from the owner's son.  It has a 'cute' atmosphere for lack of a better word.

Service: Always friendly servers, usually one person working in the front.  They have been very accommodating to my needs. It is usually not too busy, as most orders seem to be delivery or pickup.

Food: As I said before, it is very consistently tasty.  There seems to be some variation on dishes based on who is cooking (my guess).  Some times ingredients may change slightly, but I have never minded.

Recommendations: Try the Pad See Ew w/ Beef.  I get it virtually every time I go.  They make it better than any other Richmond district restaurant I have tried, which is many.  The Pumpkin Curry is also another favorite, but it seems to vary less restaurant to restaurant.  All of the appetizers are quite good, and the eggrolls are large and seem fresh.  If you want to try something different get the Thai Beef Jerky.  It is unlike any other appetizer I have had. Note: Their Pad Thai is a bit different than other places- it is more wet and saucy.  It is still quite tasty, but be ready for a different variation than you may be used to.

Delivery is prompt, and the driver(s) are always extremely nice. I have yet to have any bad experience with this restaurant after ordering dozens of times.
author: Benjamin C.

description: Expensive price with so little food in a big box. They do have rice inside with the food, so that make the food more little.. I think probably few chew, your food is all gone. It does not match the price.
author: Jerry S.

description: The food is good and affordable..for a place that has delivery the food is really good
author: Kristin W.

description:
I ordered for delivery via Grubhub.com this past weekend- ordered the pad thai and pumpkin chicken curry.

The pumpkin curry was good- I really liked the portions- they were very generous with the eggplant, green beans and chicken.  The sauce was yummy too but not spicy.

The pad thai was horrible- it tasted like fish sauce noodles and unfortunately I only could handle 3 bites.  Which was a bummer, since a sudden c
author: Clarissa P.

description:
It's been a while since we last visited, but we knew something's amiss when we looked at their online menu.

We ordered for delivery anyways...they do not offer fish cakes anymore.  When crab cakes were suggested, I declined...but they were delivered...

Unfortunately, as much as we'd like to love this place like we used to...we can't.  MSG was heavily used...too bad...we really used to love them...
author: Barb L.

description:
I swear that little family-run Thai restaurants have replaced the age-old Chinese delivery establishment in this city. There are Thai restaurants EVERYWHERE. The Richmond is no exception, with Thai places dotting both the residential and commercial streets. I have a few choices within my radius, but I probably come here the most often because I ride the Geary bus and it's just easiest.

I will now insert the "I want to like this place more" cliche, and here's why. I do like it for its cute background story--if you've skimmed any of its other reviews, you'll find details on the origin of the restaurant's name and hand-drawn logos in the founders' son. The tiny space also has a nice touch of whimsy with its yellow paint and miscellaneous magnets and accessories hanging around for sale.

That being said, the food here is juuuust a scoach pricier than other Thai restaurants of comparable size and quality. I guess I don't mind it too much, since clearly it's a family-run biz and it's a tough economy out there. However, if Tawan's wants to stay in line with its competition (Thai Time, King of Thai, Thai Noodle Jump hahaha), they might not want to depend on the fact that all of its customers are lazy like me and return primarily due to convenience. Or maybe they can rely on that. I dunno.

Finally, a word about their Som Tum salad. It had a great flavor until I realized that it was laced with those little frozen shrimps... you know, the kind that come in your Cup 'o Noodle? It was kind of gross, to be honest, and dissatisfying for the price. Other than that, though, their curries are decent.
author: Kate V.

description: What can I say about this place, it's amazing! In my opinion, the staple for every Thai restaurant is the quality of their Pad Thai noodles. If the Pad Thai is good, then the rest of the menu seems to follow suit. This place is no exception to that rule, excellent Pad Thai! My personal favorite item on the menu is the Papaya salad (w/Mango). It is to die for!! Try it out!
author: William C.

description:
This review is of their delivery. I used grubhub.com

Gaeng Khiaw-Warn (Curry Green Curry medium spicy): This was decent, but I have to say not my favorite. I am very particular about my green curry and this wasn't the best I've had

Peanut Sauce: good but pricy for how little they give you

Thung Thong: yum, fried deliciousness!

FBI (fried banana and Ice cream): Good but they didn't bring me ice cream....:(

Overall I like this place for easy to get thai food. The food quality is consistent and the customer service is great but the food is really just average.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
For delivery:
Ordered the Pad Thai and it was bland. I decided to add siracha to give it some flavor and it turned out alright. I also  ordered the Shrimp fresh spring rolls. The order comes with two spring rolls. The first one was really good and the sauce was great. However, when I started to eat the second spring roll midway through I found a long black hair in it.
Safe to say I'm not going to order from here again!
author: Natalie V.

description: Just tried the Chicken with Cashew nuts and it was delicious. A little disappointed with the portion size just because I know other restaurants in the area where I can eat Thai food for two days... this gave me one dinner only unfortunately. I ordered for pick-up and the food was ready with a smiley server at the time I asked. I think i'd order again if I was nearby but there are just so many other Thai options in the area!
author: Dana J.

description:
So my girlfriend kept telling me how spicy this place was, and based on that I gave it a whirl a couple months back.  Well the food tasted ok, but we asked for it the spiciest Thai spicy they could make, and it really wasn't all that spicy.

So this week she had to take a work trip to Idaho (a state completely void of spicy) and when I asked her what she wanted to do for dinner tonight she said she just wanted something super spicy and suggested this place.  So we went and asked for super duper Thai ultra spicyness and again not a whole lot of kick.

So yeah now she's been pouting ever since we left and guess who has to put up with it?  I'll give you a hint, not Tawan's Thai Food!
author: John S.

description:
**Disclaimer: Don't be afraid of the 3 (stars). It's strong.

Story: The moment I laid eyes on this restaurant's logo 4 years ago, I knew I wanted to eat there. Anyplace bold enough to have that sign up deserved my money.

Fast forward to Friday.... The story of the restaurant is touching. The drawings... I spent a good 5 minutes laughing at the drawings. The food was aight (not bad, not great). The shrimp-fried-rice-special-thing stole the show that evening. My sliced-chicken-thing with the name 'something-something-rot' was sweet and kind of a disappointment. Also, I've learned that Thai restaurants all brew their Thai Tea and add syrup, adding the milk in at serving time. This is not helpful for those who don't like things so sweet. 

Service was OK....

Verdict: Try it. This place is cozy and amusing. The folks that eat here obviously know better dishes to choose than I did. All in all, it's not the worst place you could go to... and this isn't the ringing endorsement that I was thinking it would be.

Oops.
author: David F.

description:
Very cute Thai restuarant! Tawan has cute drawings and photos all over the place. Vivian D. and I met up here for dinner sometime this week. Haven't seen her in ages and there were much to catch up on. Tawan was the perfect place to do so cause the place is small, cozy and very warming.

I'm usually not a fan of Thai food but their fried rice is the best Thai fried rice I've ever had. For appetizers we shared the crab cake and their chicken wings. The appetizers, I didn't really care for but the fried rice was WOWOWOW!!!! The perfect flavor and texture in one plate. The bite of the crunchy string beans and the salty dried shrimp balanced out very well with the tart yet sweet tomatoes. It was even tasty two days later! (leftover of work)

Great choice, great choice! Will come back soon to try their noodles.

-1 star because they charge $1 for tea.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Once you walk in, you immediately notice how limited the space is here. Its a cozy little place, with only about 6 tables and the walls are covered with cute "kid" drawings (apparently created by the owner's kid).  I loved the menu design - very original and creative.  It begins with the story of how the restaurant came up with the name "Tawan" (named after the owner's son) and each page has a fun drawing done by Tawan.

Overall, the food was excellent. We had pad thai, a spicy chicken entree, brown rice, and papaya salad (loved the salad!).  Not only was the food good, but pretty cheap - another win-win for the consumer!  The food also came out relatively quick and our table was constantly monitored by the waiter.  The only negative aspect of the dining experience was the fact that our server had a not-so-nice demeanor and her body language reeked with an attitude of "I hate my job."  Maybe she was having a bad day. Who knows. 

Pretty good thai food, for a decent price. And cool menus.  Another win!
author: M P.

description: I ordered delivery.  They were prompt and the pumpkin curry was so delicious I wanted to drink it.  Luckily I have a little more self control than that.  Just a little.
author: Courtney C.

description: I have no complaints. We wanted to try a new place and noticed this place has very good reviews on Yelp. I was surprised that the place was so empty on a Friday, but we gave it a shot anyway. (it was a weird night, other places were empty also). We ordered more than enough for 2 knowing we'd take some home. The Tom Yum Gai soup was awesome as was the Larb Salad, Pumpkin Curry, Goog-Gra-Borg. The latter is shrimp & bacon wrapped in an egg roll wrapper and deep fried. Mmm-mmm good. Every dish tasted fantastic and unique. The ambiance isn't top notch. Don't go there if you're looking for that, but if you want really good food at a reasonable price, a la San Tung, this is your Thai restaurant.
author: Rich M.

description: Had the pad see ew and it was amazing! The owner was also nice and friendly. I had my food in less than 5 minutes.
author: Geoff B.

description:
Tawan's food is normal fair.

The yellow (Gaeng Ga) curry is tasty!  And the fried flat noodles (Pad See-Ew) is good (dry style). However the Satay (both beef and chicken) is to be avoided! They were both dry and over cooked.  Think cowboy style tough dry jerky.  The egg rolls are also very basic.  The skin is thick like the egg rolls of old 30+ years ago.  Bubbly skin vs smooth.

The Pad Thai, red (Panaeng) curry are all ok.  Overall the food is basic and ok.

Lastly, don't be surprised when you see there logo.
author: JL S.

description:
My boyfriend and I have lived in the richmond for over a year and have tried just about every thai place in the neighborhood looking for the perfect one. We finally found it! After two tries we are sold!

Quality: great flavor, fresh veggies, good chicken
Quantity: large servings - one meal is dinner and left overs
Customer service: So friendly! Quick too
Price: Good prices

I don't think I could be more happy to finally found this place!
author: Alx N.

description: Off the bat, the lady is very rude. She asked my friend how spicy he wanted his dish, he took a while to think about it and she very rudely said, "How spicy!?" It was instantaneous, seriously. Then the Thai ice tea came. There was so much half and half, I didn't even bother to take a sip. The guy was very nice about replacing it. The replacement one was very good. The food is super good, but the portions are small. It's weird, but it was just enough for a girl my size (petite 5'2, with a small appetite) to eat, so I shouldn't be complaining. But if you have a bigger appetite than me, well, you might need to get two orders.
author: Stacy C.

description: Very disappointed. It took over 90 minutes for our food to be delivered and four calls before they answered the phone. When the food finally arrived it was mediocre at best. My order of Spicy string beans only had 5 string beans in it and the red sauce was extremely watery. The pumpkin curry was over cooked.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
3.6 stars

Lenza and I downed a boat load of food when we went here. zOMG, I think we ordered 4 mains and 2 apps for two people. The service was excellent and thai food was solid. It was super memorable but I'd definitely go back again. God I love thai food.
author: Michael S.

description:
Small and easy to miss so you really have to slow down on Geary in order to notice this place.
The food was good, service was excellent, and Tawan's drawings from when he was a kid is framed all over the restaurant. Super kawaii!
Their tom yum was also very yummy.
author: Susy C.

description: They have the best pad ki Mao ! Super tasty and tofu eater or vegetarians you are going to love this dish ! They also have good soup ! Tofu tod with peanut sauce is the best !!!! Good value for money & Quality food !
author: Prayank J.

description:
I'm giving Tawan's five adorable stars for being such an adorable place.  Yes, it's small, but it's well worth a visit.  As others have mentioned, the restaurant is named after the owners' son (who was 10 when I met him 5 years ago and he told me he attended Star of the Sea School across the street).  

Besides the atmosphere and the food (I really like their green curry), they also sell nice art and gifts!  Tawan's drawings (on the menus) are adorable and at one point you could even buy framed versions--not sure if they still sell them, but they were very reasonably priced and I bought a bunch as gifts for friends.  Over the years I've also bought other art made by their staff, including a really great bracelet and barrettes.  It's a great place to go for many reasons!
author: Cassidy P.

description:
I love this place.  Very interesting, small, and one of the best thai restaurants I've been, and the perfect place for a 100th review!  A shame that I moved shortly after discovering this place - I used to live within walking distance, but now will need to put this place on my list of weekend eats.

Great service, good food (not overly flavored, fresh and subtle tastes and a good variety).  I love the decorations - every time I come here I like to tell my friends about Tawan and exclaim over his cute artwork.   It's a very small place and they sell jewelery on the walls...one of these days I am going to buy some of that jewelery....

One of the best places for Pad Thai.  Their pumpkin curry is good, as well as the dessert roti.  Calamari appetizer's weren't that impressive though (think battered fish 'n chips but with calamari...not my thing but it may just be yours).
author: Shinny L.

description:
Apparently, "Tawan" means "cockroach."

Today I went to Tawan's for the first time.  Right after we ordered, I saw a cockroach crawling down the wall next to me.  My husband disposed of it.  

We moved to a table on the other side of the restaurant.  Half way through our meal, I saw another cockroach crawling on the wall next to our new table.

Needless to say, if there are roaches in the dining room one can only imagine what is crawling in the kitchen. . . 

We stopped eating and asked for the bill.  The restaurant did not even give us a discount, much less comp us our meal!  When I asked the owner if he was seriously going to charge us the full amount, he replied "We just had pest control here last week, I don't know what the problem is."

Well, guess what?  It's your problem, not mine. . . 

The presence of cockroaches is unacceptable, but the unwillingness to take responsibility is unforgivable.
author: SF Reviewer S.

description:
I really really wanted to love this place, and hey it was A-OK, but sadly, it was not the epic thai food that I was told it was. 

The setting is very funny - small with great decor, drawings from their son, great little hole in the wall, cute place. 

I ordered the Pad Kee Mao with ground chicken and hot...this was very good...not enough fish sauce/spice to be truly authentic but so many fresh, crispy veggies! this was a different style, but one of the better kee maos i've had! I also had a Hoegaarden, not fantastic as belgian wits go, but accompanies thai food so so well! 

However, my wife ordered the Pad Thai...so I know that this is an invented/not authentic dish but it is still one of my go-to dishes and is a make or break on a restaurant. The pad thai was simply sub-par to say the least. WAY too sweet (i hate it when they load pad thai with sugar and don't balance it with prik nam pla, lime and tamarind) it had zero spice and was almost flavorless with no peanuts or shredded carrots/cabbage on the side, and some dried out chewy tofu (shrimp was good though) so disappointing. 

So, if you go stay away from the pad thai.
author: Ben B.

description:
After spending some time at Golden Gate Park (a couple months ago - yes, a delayed review), we wanted to find somewhere close by to grab some lunch.  Thanks to Yelp, we found this little restaurant.  This place is tiny - we almost walked by it!

Food was good, and they were child friendly (minus the jewelry for sale hanging from the wall next to the tables - my child thought those were for grabbing!).  Parking was easy to find, too - on the street.  It was a good find for us hungry folks!
author: Christy L.

description: A good place to grab grub after the thai massage across the street. The mom is cooking in the back, and Tawan's dad does the deliveries. Its a neighborhood staple.
author: Johnson H.

description: Yet another hidden treasure!! We had the coconut soup with shrimp, brown rice, and some sort of seafood stir fry, it was all great. The best part had to be the sticky rice and mango though. There fruit (mango) was the perfect ripeness, and was delicious with the rice. I will be back!
author: Matthew M.

description:
So I love Thai, I've tried a few in the Bay area. Nothing was quite hitting the spot like back home. I wasn't aware that the Inner Richmond was the spot for some good Asian flavors. This is how we stumbled upon Tawan's. In the prior reviews the references to the children's book style menu is what really peaked our interest so we stopped by.

It's a small place but comfortable and it definitely centers on the idea of promoting Thai children's art. There are some fun works displayed on the walls and the menu is like fun art in it as well. My one beef with the place is that the menu is probably too large. There are TONS of options.

Anywho, to the food, well we ordered #35 Pumpkin Curry and #55 Salmon Red Curry. This is my first time having pumpkin curry and it was nice. A more velvety curry with some nice sweet notes. I don't think it will replace normal curry in my books but I was glad I tried it. I will definitely have it again near Halloween for shits and gigs..
