The curry sauce for the Salmon was outstanding. Probably one of my more favorite Red Curries right now and that curry alone makes Tawan's my favorite Thai place in SF thus far. Ohh yea, and the Salmon was nice to, more on the fishier end of flavor, but I like it.

The waitress was great also. Overall I will definitely come back!
author: Nik B.

description: I will just have to say...Whoa! (joey from Friends voice) Beautiful, comfortable, and delicious.  Sounds like my kind of man...lol.  Had some spicy coconut curry with brown rice and Satay Tofu as an appetizer.  They have truly stolen my heart.  "Yo respect." (Ali G voice) when you are in town.
author: Salonje R.

description:
Waited 90 minutes for below average Thai , delivered. The egg rolls were dull. The soup was terrible. Everything else also barely edible and way too spicy. The fried rice had large pieces of lemongrass. Wow. Too bad. 

We will not be ordering from Tawan's Thai Food again. Did I mention it was half an hour late as well?
author: Simon W.

description:
Shrimp Fresh Spring Roll - So-so. Got 2 huge rolls, ingredients were fresh, except it had a kinda fishy taste, which I didn't like. I thought the peanut sauce would help, but it also had an odd taste. Would have been nice if they cut the rolls in halves. Not interested in trying again.

Chicken Satay - So-so. Kinda dry but enough to eat. Not interested in trying again.

Tom Yum Gai Soup - Very lemony and fresh, which I like. However, it was different than other Tom Yums I've had. Not interested in trying again.

Pork Larb - Tasted like basic ground beef with a lemony flavor, kinda different than other restaurants. Not interested in trying again.

Overall, for me it was edible but no wow factor, and I would not order from this restaurant again. Quantity is not bad and other people might find it an ok place to eat.
author: Sonia D.

description:
HOOCHBAG RECOMMENDATION.

When I first came to the city and moved in with some hoochbag girls that just graduated from SFSU always came to eat here. I thought it was okay Thai food but they thought it was "the best". And for some odd reason, I hardly ate anything and always picked up their tab. Hoochbag xfriends and their stupid recommendation of what's decent. 

I'm going to be flat honest, the service was good and the staff were really nice and genuwine. They always had people here and they looked like they were enjoying their food. The dishes we had didnt fill my palate and I thought the (in tagalog we'd call is sabow) sauce/juices of the dishes looked watery and oily together. Nothing stood out to me. I drive all the way across the city and probably have passed the real good thai restaurants in the city to be here, eating okay thai food, with hoochbag xfriends.
author: Jane A.

description:
I am saddened to write this, because we really enjoyed our first meal there about six weeks ago, we love the drawings, we like the people and we really wanted to come away from last night's dinner there with friends just raving about it.  But we didn't.  Maybe we ordered badly--too many fried things--so I want to think it was our fault.  The beef pumpkin curry and the featured ground chicken dish were actually quite good, but maybe next time we want Thai we will give someone else a try after rather mediocre takeout and an eat-in dinner that just was not special enough.
Just being honest.
author: Barry R.

description:
The first thing I ate as an SF resident was a take-out spring roll from Tawan's. Eight months later, I returned (it took me a while to go back, because my wife couldn't remember where she got the spring rolls). Anyways....

We went for dinner last week. I got the pumpkin curry and my wife got the yellow curry. Both were tasty, and served crazy fast. We also ordered mango and sticky rice. It was at the same time, sticky and mango-y. We enjoyed. The bill was pretty reasonable. Less than $30 (including two drinks and tip). 

Oh yeah....There are these drawings by Tawan, the owners' son, covering the walls and menu. They're hilarious. Seriously. I want to buy them all.
author: Aaron Z.

description:
BTW - their menu is available here: http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/tawans-thai-food/menu

I had the Pad Ped (sliced chicken, eggplant, bell pepper, red coconut curry) for delivery. Awesome! And it came super quick!
author: Gillian M.

description: Great Tom Khar soup.  Wife likes the Pad Thai but seems too sweet and has too much citrus.  Super slow service
author: Scott L.

description:
So on our mission to try new restaurants and find something good (as we have been on a bad streak) we landed at Tawan Thai. Tawan is a very small Thai restaurant located on Geary in the Inner Richmond. Seating is limited, but there was only one other table seated so it wasn't a problem. They do offer "free" delivery for those who don't want to leave the confines of their couches like myself sometimes. 

What stroke the most about Tawan Thai was the decor. Within the menu and on the walls they had little illustrations of random things. It didn't matter that the pictures looked like they were drawn by a 5 year old, because it was still neat and interesting to look at. They even sold little trinkets nearby the cash register. Anyways, that was all that really stood out about the restaurant. Well, something did stand out about the food... and it was the blandness. Everything just had a smidgen of flavor, literally. The stuffed wings were crisp and plump, but the lack of flavor killed it for me. When it came down to the salad, it seemed like everything was just thrown in a pan or boiled, plated, and then sprinkled with some lemon on top. The Pad Thai barely had any peanut flavor or sweetness to it. Perhaps it was late in the day and they just ran out of every seasoning? The most promising dish was one of the specials. The last dish we tried was silver noodles with snow peas, mushrooms, something else, with a green curry mixed throughout. This dish definitely had some flavor and a little heat to it. 

Would I go back? probably not... time to move on and discover something else that tantalizes my taste buds. Perhaps I already exhausted my options as far as new places. Maybe I should just stick to my tried and true.
author: Steven T.

description:
I'm crying right now because I made the mistake of getting the silver noodle salad at the level of "hot spicy."  WOOOT it's HOT!

Tawan Thai is always ready when I'm too lazy to make dinner after a long day at work.  Everything is smooth: not oily, not salty.  You can get your usual pad thai, curries (their pumpkin curry is delicious!), and satays.  But while another reviewer called this bland, to me it's simple and pretty.  Every dish comes out colorful and appetizing.

Just watch out for the spiciness level!!!  I just rinsed the silver noodles in cold water and it's still not edible.  I'll have to let this one go this time  =(
author: Kayan W.

description:
This is another one of those small places with big food. I had the Pad Thai (because I always get Pad Thai whenever I have Thai food... it's not original, so sue me) and it was really, really good. On top of that, the portions were huge! I also had the fish cakes as an appetizer, and they were REALLY good. You can tell they're freshly made and not frozen because the cakes aren't all uniformed, they were differently sized.

I also had one of the soups (it's the second one on the lunch menu) and it was SOOOO GOOD! It's one of those things that I tasted, and I knew I would have cravings for it in the middle of the night.

The only thing I was disappointed with was that mango is out of season so they were out of the mango sticky rice, which I really wanted to try. Oh well, at least they're honest. They could have given me some gross canned mango instead.

The decor is modern (Ikea-esque) and cute. The drawings are adorable! The service was fine, but we were the only table having lunch at 3pm, so I can't judge it based on that.

I'll definitely be back!
author: Sara K.

description:
This place has great Thai food, delivery if you are close and take-out is welcomed. I like their chicken curry and veggie plates. The pad thai is good too. They scored 98 on a scale of 1-100 on their inspection for those of you that worry about inspection ratings.

So for good, decent priced Thai food in the inner richmond district, give Tawan's a try ;0) you will enjoy!
author: Bella B.

description:
wow I've lived in the Richmond 7 years never realized there was good Thai in the area. After a yelp search and 3 great dishes, I'm a fan. 
The red curry salmon, beef salad, and chicken rice scallion mushroom thing are really great dishes!
author: John N.

description:
I think most of what I could say about Tawan's has already been said!  We went to this tiny little restaurant and had a really good meal, after they finally opened back up after their trip overseas. We watched for the sign to go down each morning driving down Geary on the way into work...

Anyway, we had an excellent calamari "larb" salad for an appetizer - and the "medium spice" really had some kick to it, and for the main dishes we had some tomato-ey chicken dish, and a eggplant+chicken dish. Both were really good (particularly the eggplant that almost had a roasted taste to it - very good), but I think the salad was the highlight. 

The only drawback to the evening was the wait. Sure we waited to get in, that's fine -- but after we were seated there was a veery long wait for the appetizer, and even longer wait between the appetizer and the main meal. It seemed like an hour from sitting down to main dish (I'm not kidding - I am pretty sure we arrived just after 7 and left around 9.)

But we'll certainly be back - based on the other reviews it doesn't sound like a regular issue.
author: Jen D.

description:
A little gem in the inner Richmond that serves delicious Thai food.  I wish it was closer to our house so we could enjoy it more often. 

I have been many times to Tawan's and most of the time find myself ordering the same dishes. The deep fried whole fish with sweet chili sauce is just amazing and crunchy.  It is my husband's favorite. The pad ped is a perfect mix of veggies and meat, as you can choose chicken, beef or shrimp, in a delicate curry and coconut milk sauce. . The also have a beef with cabbage and carrots in a pepper and garlic sauce very nicely done.      

It is a small little place with 6-7 tables with cute decor focused on the hand drawings of the son of the couplle that owns the restaurant, when he was a kid.  His name is Tawan.  The service is good, the waiters and the owners are very friendly,  and they are very accommodating if you have a big party.  Just call in advance. 

The only downside, they do go on vacation every summer and close the restaurant for a few weeks.  Good for them though !!
author: Adriana C.

description: I've been eating here for years.  Consistently great food.  Tung tong is the best!
author: Jordan R.

description:
WORST RESTURANT EVER!!!

I ordered pad thai (without tofu, highly allergic) and they when I received my food it had tofu in it! I called demanded my money back; they insisted that I show them the food in order to receive a refund. Completely Ridiculous!!!

I showed them my food and they gave me a new order---NOT my money back!

Horrible service! PLEASE SAVE YOURSELF THE TROUBLE AND DO NOT SUPPORT THIS RESTURANT!!!
author: Anne D.

description:
Great local mom and pop joint that makes you feel like you walked into their home with all the home-made drawings on the wall apparently made by their son back in the day (I hear he is a university student now). The walls also feature jewelry and magnets for sale. The menu is very sweet and unique - contains drawings by their son and it is definitely full of many yummy options at reasonable prices and a nice selection of veg options. One reviewer had beef with the "extensive selection" but I don't think it's a huge difference from other Thai restaurants I've been to. They do have a good selection of bottled beer (Hoegarden, Shock Top and more - $3.50) and wine ($5-8 a glass). Corking fee is $8/wine bottle. It definitely is a small place but they pushed 3 tables together to accommodate our party of 10. 

Lots of dishes were ordered but I only tried 3 -  pad see ewe, paenaeng curry and broccoli in an oyster sauce. All 3 were very good. My only issue was that I requested my curry to be very spicy, ie. "Thai style" and thought it was a good sign when the server warned me of how spicy it will be. But the dish barely had any heat to it. What gives?? My friend said the pumpkin curry was just ok. He's been here a handful of times and said they have made it better in the past. They had rotee (fried pancake with sweet condensed milk for $2.50) and sticky rice with mango ($4.95) but we were too stuft to give it a try. Next time! Parking was a breeze too. Fyi, if you come with a large group, they say there's a limit of 2 credit cards per table so bring cash.
author: Shelley L.

description:
Oh my! Yellow curry chicken with brown rice, perfectly tender chunks of chicken and potatoes.  Tangy larb ground beef with essence of lime and mint with perfectly fresh cabbage leaves.  What could be better on a stormy night?!  No delivery charge, $15 min. 
This place is going on speed dial!
author: Gina P.

description:
I'd give this place more stars if they were more consistent.  I've been there for both dinner and lunch and have have good experiences and disappointment. I've enjoyed their chicken with chili and basil and Tom Yum Gum (sp).  My biggest complaint is that their rice is often dry and stale ( like it was made the day before or something).

I just with they were more consistent.
author: Javier A.

description: The food has been consistent for the past 18 years I've been going here. Just the best Thai food in the city, hands down. Awesome people, so friendly and accommodating... my absolute favorite in the city
author: Lo F.

description:
found this place with help from yelp reviews on a recent trip to san fran
i had the pad kee mow and it was awesome! i really liked the fact that it had egg in it, i wish more places did that! it could have been a little spicier, but now i just know to order hot instead of medium next time!
my boyfriend had the pumpkin curry and he fell in love! we are searching the phoenix area for a thai place that has it!
$20 for 2 people for lunch was a great deal
i will be back next time im in the bay area!
author: Nicole P.

description: I was debating whether to review this place because my beef is with the customer service experience, since husband and I didn't get to eat here. Anyway, I'm going ahead, and I just want to say that 20 minutes from the time you sit down and no one acknowledges that they'll help you as soon as they can (yes, they were busy), is crappy service. There was not even a gaze towards our direction during those 20 minutes, even though we were seated when we walked in. I mean, we WERE seated, so our presence was known! And, the place is very small, so it's not that hard to lose track of which customers are waiting. Hey waitress/cashier gal, we can tell you're busy taking phone orders, but at least a simple "Please give me a minute" would have sufficed instead of ignoring us. That, in itself is enough for us to not give your business a chance.
author: X L.

description:
I had the tom kha gai soup and the pad thai. The tom kha gai soup was tasty and delicious. The pad thai was WAY too sweet. I have never had a more sugary pad thai. Also, the fried tofu in the pad thai was over cooked and crispy. The pumpkin curry that a friend got was pretty good.

My coworker got her meal about 40 minutes after she ordered, ours took about 15-20 minutes. They obviously forgot it but made lame excuses like it was busy. The restaurant was NOT busy. They were not apologetic AND charged us 18% gratuity. We did not feel that it deserved an 18% gratuity. I would not eat here again. Especially with all of the other good places in the area.
author: Reena P.

description:
For some people it's a bucket of original recipe, for others it's a pint of Häagen-Dazs triple brownie fudge, but for me, my comfort food is Red Curry. Not just any red curry mind you, but THAI RED CURRY. Oh, and none of that peanut crap, mine better be coconut based.

I've been on the hunt for the best Thai restaurant ever since I returned from Thailand over two years ago. I FINALLY found it!

Tawan's does it right. I haven't been sleeping well lately due to allergies, but after a round of Som Tam and Red Curry (Thai spicy), I was all cleared up and slept like a dream. 

Thanks for putting hair on my chest Tawan!
author: Dan W.

description:
This place gets five stars for the mainly for the food being so authentic.  Yes, the prices are a bit higher than others, but you get what you pay for here.  If you want fast, go to King of Thai.  And for those reviewers who want great service, go to fucken Gary Danko's.   I don't understand people who expect the same great service in a restaurant where you pay under 10 bucks a dish to one where you pay upwards of 30 bucks a dish.    
Anyway, if you want great authentic thai food in a casual setting of a family run restaurant, this is the place to go.  I've been to many thai restaurants in NYC, Bangkok, and here and have to say that the food here is top notch.
author: Will C.

description:
I am so glad I finally came to this cute joint. Cute on the outside, cute on the inside. A very small, quaint spot in Inner Richmond. I met my friend up here for dinner. There was one empty table -- win! The menu is the most adorable thing ever. Apparently it's named after the owner's son Tawan, and the menu features many of his drawings (he is a kid), and they add so much character to it!

We had pad thai and a pork/green beans dish and they were both delicious and spicy.

Simple, delicious, my go to Thai spot in the hood.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
OMG the best food ever. The service is excellent but they make you feel right at home.
Their stuffed chicken is GREAT!!!
author: S M.

description:
After one of the coldest nights in the city i was hoping to have a welcoming warm and delicious meal here at Tawans but instead my friend and i found ourselves waiting at least 10 mins before someone decided to come take our order and then even an additional 30 mins before any food was brought out including our appetizer. 

the food was ok when it was finally served but found it hard to compete with the other Thai favorites in the city.

At lot of the kitchen's attention was given to the constant phone orders coming in for the dinner rush. i did appreciate the playful decor of the place and the fun child inspired menu design.
author: Gabe H.

description:
Service is outstanding, very attentive. Food is speechless!

We ordered the crepe appetitizer, salmon red curry and pak see ew.  Crepe is very crispy with right balance of bean spouts and other ingredients,  very crunchy and nice flavor.  Salmon is good, great mix of spices and cocount milk.  Pad see ew is kind of average.

Price is very reasonable
author: Sandy L.

description:
The beef jerky I always get here are phenomenal! The people at Tawan's are friendly and the food is always good. They'll make it real spicy if you ask too!

I don't usually go on searches for the best of whatever-cuisine restaurants, but my love for Thai food has brought me to many Thai places in San Francisco. I love Tawan's the best!
author: Stephanie B.

description: Great family owned restaurant.  Flavors are great!  Love their Tom Yum Gung soup.  Not a fancy restaurant by any means, but the small cozy homestyle feel is what makes it special.  Highly recommend.
author: Avery L.

description:
My co-workers and I came here based on the four star Yelp review. I could not be more disappointed.  I got the pad see ew, which took them 40 minutes to get to the table. I ended up having to take it to go, since I would be late for an appointment otherwise. It was way too salty. 

The rest of the group I was with got their food about 20 minutes before me. Pad Thai tasted like it was made with ketchup and was too sweet. The tofu bites were dried out. One of the fried rice dishes was okay. The waitress was not apologetic about the food being so late and said that the restaurant was busy.  Interesting explanation since a couple who put in their order after our table was already done with their food and out of the restaurant before I got my dish. There were only two other groups at the restaurant for lunch hour. More likely, they forgot to make the dish and were making lame excuses. 

To make up for this poor service or mistake, most places would throw in a drink or take off the charge for a dish. They did not even comp our appetizer and had the gall to add 18% gratuity for crappy service.  I am never coming back here again and would recommend that others avoid this place as well, unless you are interested in mediocre Thai food and poor customer service.

Cute concept for the restaurant name, but TOTAL miss on everything else that makes a restaurant worth going to. Sorry, wish I could have liked it.
author: N c.

description: I use to eat here once a week. I always get the Spicy and Sour chicken soup. Tonight when the soup came it had a horrid smell! It smelled like the chicken had been sitting out for weeks! The taste was just as bad. I told the waitress that I did not want it and I wanted to order something else. She went to tell the manager and they said that they would re-make the soup! And that I would have to pay for it! I told her that was not good customer  service and that I would never return. The place has gone downhill in the past year. I hope I don't get food poisoning!
author: Jewli J.

description:
This is a good restaurant- but I was really psyched for it based on the reviews and as a result felt let down when I left. SF has hundreds of great Thai places. To me, a 5 star rating means the place has to be exceptional. I think there is a bit of over yelping here. 

SF has some old well established places like Marnee or Thep Phanom- this place isn't one of those.
author: carbon b.

description:
DROOLS!!

This place was really good.  Small, but cute.  Extremely good service even with just one waitress (fast and consistent).  Good service = extra tip ($$!)  Very cute graphics on their menu.  I'm a softy for cute cartoons.  LOL.

Their portions are pretty big for $8.95/dish.  Usually, at other Thai restaurants, I'd get smaller portions for $$ much more.  Oh, and parking wasn't too bad to find.  Came here on a Saturday night and luckily I found parking in front!  =)  One thing for sure, not meant for big groups.

Pad Thai w/ Chicken.  HELLA GOOD.  Nice and creamy w/ perfect noodle thickness!

Pumpkin Curry w/ pork (medium spicy!).  OoOo yessss, soo good.  Even with the medium spicy, you could definitely feel it.  Sauce was very delicious and flavorful!  

Par-Ram Chicken.  Yummmy!  Sauce was thick, just the way I like it ;)

Will most likely come back again.
author: MaryGrace V.

description:
We ordered some food late last night, but didn't get one of our items.  We weren't billed for it, but we still wanted it.  We called them up (it was so late, only take-out was available) and explained and they made us one more, even after they had closed.

Thanks for that, Tawan's!
author: Gavin S.

description:
This wonderful little restaurant opened years ago when I was working just down the street along Geary.  Please don't judge me, but somehow, at the time (I think I was around 17 or so), I had yet to experience the flavor-gasm that is Thai food--I know...I know...I'm a disgrace to my San Francisco roots.

Anyhoo--several of my co-workers had gone and come back with fantastic tales to tell--great food, lunch specials, amazing prices, a nice staff--what can I say, I'm easy.  From the very first dish I ordered (the Gratiam-Prikthai) I was hooked.  Years later and literally every single dish I've ordered has impressed, although we have fallen into a pretty set menu when we order: the Yum Sarm Sa Hai, Chicken Panang Curry, Guay Tiaw Gai Gra Praow (except when I can convince the bf that it just feels like more of a Pork Pad Kee Mao night--yum!), two Thai Iced Teas, white rice for four, and--on nights when we're feeling expecially crazy--the FBI.

All of this is ordered in delivery form only, for as much as I love this place, it's not the most conducive to dining in.  Although they do let you BYOAB (that's "bring your own alcoholic beverage") to enjoy with your dinner, and Tawan's cute artwork from years ago hangs on the walls--there's only a handful and tables and they're usually full, if not overflowing, around dinner time.

Only two complaints--they aren't open on Sundays (an especially good day for Thai) and the whole restaurant shuts down for a month or two every summer for a trip to the homeland.  This second one is not so much a complaint in and of itself--but those months usually perfectly coincide with when I want me some Tawan's the most...like right now...
author: Jasmine L.

description:
Love this little Thai restaurant.  In my opinion, the best Tom Yum Goong soup ever!  Also, their sweet spicy chicken wings are some of the best I've had.  They're crunchy and chewy...very different from the typical wings you get elsewhere.  

They're a small family-owned business, and their special home recipes are evident in their dishes.  I have tried a few other dishes that seem simple, but super delicious without overloading with spice.

I'm a die-hard fan, now!
author: Jaymes L.

description:
I don't have much to add to the sea of great feedback here. We came here after reading a great review in the San Francisco Chronicle and weren't disappointed. Every single dish we had was delicious: Goong Gra Borg appetizer, Silver Noodle Salad (awesome chile-lime dressing), Pad See Ew noodles and the Rotti dessert. 
Will come back!
author: O Z.

description:
So when I first moved to San Francisco I had NO IDEA what Thai food was... Within 3 days I was brought to my first Thai restaurant, Osha, which I will also review!

Tawan's was my second Thai experience, and I go back frequently. Partly because of the location, I'm a sucker for places that don't require me to leave my house, and partly because of the deal!

Tawan's fits my "Fuck I'm a grad student' budget, and isn't one of those cheap thai places that gives you pad thai and you have to cut the noodles like a casserole because they have molded together into a brick... No, Tawan's is quality at a family price. Plus I always get 2 meals out of the deal! 

Family also excites me.. the adorable family that runs this place use their sons, or grandsons artwork as their signature. It's everywhere, the decoration, the logo.. ADORABLE

Cheap Family Fun.. and no this isn't your local zoo :) Yay Tawan's 

XOXO
author: Hailey P.

description:
Jessica L. and I ordered takeout last night from here and it was sooo good. 

Green Curry - we ordered the mild and it was still pretty spicy. But still good. 

Pad See Ewe - perfect noodle thickness and sauce. Loved it. 

Silver Noodle Salad - Very good. Best to eat last if you have multiple things because it's very refreshing. It's mild and light but still packed with flavor. 

Takeout dishes - SOOO great. They are like little fake tupperware pieces. I almost kept mine for my own lunches. I probably will next time. 

I will definitely be ordering from here again. 45-minute estimated delivery came in 50-minutes (during dinner rush hour). Total price was $30 including tip. There would have been lots of leftovers if it wasn't so good.
author: Ali R.

description:
And again, I have to credit my job for being so close to this little gem of a Thai restaurant.

I've done the Marnee Thai thing, and I'd have to say that I'm much more of a Tawan's Thai person.  It has about 5 4-seater tables (aka it's tiny), and the walls are painted bright yellow.  It's kind of easy to miss because it's so small and in a random location, but it's worth the circle around the block.

I've always gotten some good dishes, but my friend ordered some sort of curry that looked like a big bowl of soup with bamboo, peppers and some measly slices of beef.  The bowl of rice that he ordered paled in comparison to the huge bowl of "soup," so if you want to finish the soup/curry, you'll probably need two bowls of rice.

Their rice and noodle dishes (aka pad thai, pad see-ew, etc.) are all really good.  They ask you how spicy you want your food, and if you say "spicy," you'll probably end up with a good dose of peppers.  If you're not used to spicy food, I recommend sticking with the mild or medium.

Overall, A+ compared to Marnee Thai.  Less yuppie, more yummy.
author: Tori S.

description: I placed an order for deliver to my workplace. I had vegetarian green curry extra super spicy. The delivery was quick, the person on the phone was polite and professional, the portion size was quite large, and boy did they deliver in the spicy factor! Totally blew my face off just like I wanted :) I will order from this place again.
author: Danika X.

description:
I agree with Anna T: this place is ADORABLE, with a very cozy feel. A friend and I came here on a whim, since there are at least 54309683 other Thai restaurants to choose from in the Inner Richmond, and we were pleasantly surprised. I ordered the (vegetarian) Pad See-Ew, and I think a little piece of me died and went to heaven. Maybe it's because I had absolutely no expectations to begin with; maybe it's because my stomach was about to ingest itself from extreme (for me) hunger... but after that delicious, healthy portion of goodness, I'm definitely coming back.

Cute drawings (by young Tawan?) all over the wall, funky painted interior, nice staff, and fair prices... what more could you ask for from a casual neighborhood Thai spot?
author: Sam S.

description:
Was looking for lunch on Geary with my brother and decided that this would be it. Thai food + open parking meter (and change given for the meter!) = win!

I liked my dish - ground chicken, slices of green beans, peppers, basil. a little bit spicier than i expected for medium, but tasty. my brother wasn't as excited about his dish - Lard-Nar: chicken/broccoli over flat noodle.. too much sauce - and indeed it was in a sea of brown sauce.

Small place - cute decor sparks conversation. pleasant staff. tiny but clean restroom (through a tiny kitchen)

We got in, seated, fed, and paid, in the time of a 45 minute parking meter, without much rush. of course, it was nearly empty when we came in, but filled up by them time we finished. 

i'm not that familiar with san francisco, but if you're seeking thai and in the richmond area, this is a good place to get some.
author: James F.

description:
I Love this place! We weren't sure what to eat one night so we went for a walk down Geary and discovered this gem!
Its a tiny, hole in the wall with funky decor and only a handful of tables. The place was packed but we were seated in the one vacant table right away. I loved everything we ordered. The menu was so extensive that we decided to venture out and try dishes that we'd never had at any other thai place and nothing disappointed. I even think they deliver. About to give that a shot - we'll see how it goes.
author: natalie v.

description:
Man I really love this place - fav Thai food in my hood. Top 5 in my Thai Food places ever. NEW ITEM I LOVE HERE:

Silver Noodle Salad - its served a little bit warm and has this chili lime sauce on it SOOOOOOO yummmmmmy!
author: Jessica L.

description: Nice little place.  I just got the Pad Thai.  Shrimps were nice and big.  Good amount.  Fair price.  Clean.  Good water service.  Nice napkin quality (paper).   Pretty empty till right at noon when it was almost filled.  Menu looked to have good selections that I'd like to try again.
author: Marc S.

description:
It's been awhile since we last visited. We came back becuz we like their curry. Food are ok. Only Three of us went there but they charged us 18% gratuity fee, such "rule" was not written on the menu. They charge us 18% gratuity when we asked for the check, honestly, I don't think their service deserve 18% gratuity. Just beware when you go there, maybe just go with a large group becuz they r gonna charge you extra gratuity anyways. And it's not written anyway where in the restaurant.

I would not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Mini T.

description:
Excuse me, am I missing something? This place, so NOT a keeper. Yes, it's cute. ish. They get a star because their fish cake appetizer is one of the best fish cakes I've ever had (and I've had a lot). 

But the rest was totally forgettable. Pad see-ew was totally greasy but not very much flavor, with some huge pieces of cabbage and insipid chicken. The pad makheur yao, sauteed eggplant with tofu, was recommended to us by our server but had about 70% tofu and was blah. just blah. 

The red pumpkin curry we were excited to order and very disappointed that the pumpkin was seriously undercooked. Straight up hard. The same sauce was in the worst dish of the night, the salmon red curry. The fish was not fresh, smelled and tasted fishy, and if it were anywhere but a four-table hole in the wall, would've been sent back.  

The people who run the place are sweet, eager to please, and attentive --and maybe that's why this place has the completely undeserved high ratings. But if you actually want good food, this city has a lot better Thai to offer.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I feel like I've eaten at a lot of Thai places in the city: Lers Ros, Chaaba, Cha-am, Thai Noodle Jump, Thai Time, Ploy II, Ozone, Sai Jai Thai...
 

While Tawan wasn't quite Lers Ros (the best Thai place in SF proper in my opinion), it was pretty damn close. I got two of my favs: pad prik khing and som tham and I was pretty impressed. They can make it spicy hot too.

The restaurant itself is small but comfortable. Still I'd recommend take out. 

Price was $24 for two.
author: Car C.

description:
BYOB - W #3*

Is it a craft store? Is it a preschool? No, its a hole in the wall Thai restaurant (named after the owners son who donates the artwork to the business) which sells all sorts of beaded jewelry, displayed on several walls right alongside a plethora of kindergarten drawings of God knows what. 

They allow you to bring your own booze, so we brought plenty of our own to wash down what the menu warned would be dishes so spicy the wimpy need not apply (or at least order their dishes mild, but whatever). Not. That. Spicy. At. All. 

It is however decent hearty food at a reasonable price...unless you decide to go for a necklace purchase with your dinner, then things just might add up a bit. 
_________________________________________

*Bum wine consumed;
Boonse Watermelon - disappointing at only 4% alcohol and, surprising to all of us at the table, it is actually a beer produced by a wine company. Fruitiest beer I have ever tasted. It was more like a carbonated liquid Jolly Rancher. Definitely for the novice BW drinker.
MD 20/20 Tangerine - Tang with a kick at 13% alcohol. For the novice in their ability to stomach the taste of toxic shit but a tolerance level of a professional.
author: Drue C.

description:
this place is great! probably one of the best thai food restaurants I've eaten at! i think it's a bit pricey. but the food was really filling. I loved their curry! and for the first time i had really good pad thai =]
this place is really small but it's a nice place for a date or a small group of friends
I definitely would recommend this to anyone who's in the mood for thai food
author: Greg H.

description:
Dear Tawan, 

I have not met you but I am familiar with your work, so let me tell you a story. 

This story involves a lovely couple that live and die by delicious food. They were hungry on a Saturday night and not to mention lazy. Somehow we came across your place by searching Yelp and we were still a bit weary. We searched high and low for an online menu and made snappy decisions. 

I must say that the pad thai is ridiculous...seriously I haven't had pad thai this good since Satay House in Berkeley, may it rest in peace. We also had this peanut based curry with beef...also amazing. And finally the garlic chicken...PHENOMENAL. Ok so totally off topic, we have this thing where we can never get food hot enough. Finally a place that hears, 'medium heat' and actually delivers. 

Tawan, I want you to know that you can get it. Any day and any night. As long as u bring me a bucket of pad thai. Plus, I heard about these stuffed wings you speak of...bring them to me also. 

Tawan, I love you and I'm leaving my boyfriend for you but he's going to have to watch. sorry

Britt

p.s. call me.
author: Brittany D.

description:
When I first moved to San Francisco five (!) years ago, I found myself constantly on the lookout for new places to eat.  Technically, every place was a new place to eat, but my brother had already lived here for a few years, and I wanted to really impress him by finding a great restaurant that he hadn't tried yet.

Somehow, I came across Tawan's.  I don't remember what I was doing, but there was a parking spot open right in front of it, and when I returned from whatever errand I was running, I saw the place, added more money to the meter, and ate lunch here.

I knew my brother would appreciate the funny menus.  Actually, I didn't know he would appreciate them, but I figured he would like them if only because they were cheesy and/or dated and/or poorly constructed and/or poorly conceived and/or poorly executed.

My food came quickly, and it was really good.  All of this was adding up to a four-star experience.  (It was years before Yelp existed, but I *did* rate restaurants stars-wise long before Yelp existed, although I usually did so on a scale of 0 to 10 or 0 to 7 for some reason.)  Then it happened:  Tawan came in.

At the time, Tawan was an annoying middle schooler who went to school at the Catholic school across Geary from the restaurant.  As soon as this loud, demanding kid entered, the whole place changed.  The woman who had brought me my food made a big fuss about Tawan's appearance.  He took his seat at a prime table and spread out books and toys across its four-person surface.  (Mind you, the restaurant only has a few tables.)  He began making demands of the older woman and other workers, and they brought him food and drink.

I assumed the older woman was his grandmother, but maybe it is his mother.  In any case, Tawan played the part of the pygmy dictator very well.  His middle-school presence also bumped this place up to five stars.

I bet he's a teenager by now.  If so, he's probably actually doing work at his namesake.  Maybe he's even a lowly delivery boy.  I hope not.  Or if he is, I hope he often quietly remembers his days of limitless power, the times when he ruled a little kingdom, even if it only had six tables.
author: John S.

description:
Named after the owner's son, Tawan's Thai serves up some good ol' Thai cuisine.  Most notable about the restaurant are Tawan's drawings done when he was 5 years old (he's now 14), framed onto the wall and are embedded throughout the menu--very cute.  (You can even purchase a t-shirt with the "flying pig" drawing.)  The interior is small and is done up with a homestyle flair.  The red and white plaid tablecloth make it seem as though you're picnicking with the family.

The food is great, the service is friendly--well accomodating of my friend's picky needs--plus, they deliver.  The uniqueness of the place earns them a fifth star.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
This hole in the wall place that will go unnoticed by most people. I visited this place on a recommendation from a running partner, so I was naturally very hungry after my workout.

Upon entering, I noticed the decor and menus looked like they were designed by a child. Indeed, Tawan is the name of the owner's son, who attends a local private school across the street. Cute touch.

We ordered the Som Tum salad, Tom Yum soup, and duck curry. Even though we were the only other group in the small restaurant, our food took a while to come out (20 minutes). I'm not sure what took them so long, but the wait certainly made the food taste better. 

The Som Tum was decent, but not awe inspiring. The Tom Yum soup was a little bland. Fortunately, the duck curry was delicious. It was nothing to write home about, and compared some of the other Thai restaurants within walking distance, Tawan was only marginally better in terms of quality. 

I'll definitely have to give it another go.
author: Jason C.

description:
I can finally give King of Thai and Osha Thai the cold shoulder, because Tawan's and I are now exclusive.  

Exclusive meaning that Tawan's is my "official" go-to place for quality, affordable Thai food in San Francisco. I've eaten here three times and  was charmed by the fresh, delicious dishes each time.  I recommend chowing down on the hot hot hot tom yum soup and the fried chicken dish with cashews. But be sure to leave room for dessert and order the rotee with condensed milk topping.  You (but not your dentist or trainer) will thank me later.

The charmingly-sized Tawan's is named after the owners' (now teenaged) son whose early whimsical drawings of "pigdogs" and other colorful animal combinations adorn the walls and menu.  Since its a lean family-run business, the service can be a bit slow sometimes, but you quickly forgive and forget once the yummy food fills your belly.
author: Deborah L.

description:
Update: Steve claims TAWAN HIMSELF is the delivery guy. I cannot believe him. Tawan would be a teenager now, and they got laws about that kind of thing. Besides, he  needs to do his homework, not schleping fried trout to my door.

Oh my heck, they have the cutest menu ever. Besides Tawan's drawings, it's all pastels and rounded corners and sans-serif fonts.

"This kid must be 18 now, could you imagine bringing your friends around?" asked Steve.

"Hell yes, I would bring my friends and eat surrounded by drawings I made when I was five," I replied with no sarcasm. I pointed to the picture above our table, a slice of mango levitating over a smiling fish.

Coincidentally, I had the dish depicted, a whole deep-fried trout with shredded mango. Excellent. Steve had his typical chicken and cashew dish. They did something to the chicken, it was slightly crisp like it was coated with cornstarch or deep-fried, or both. We had the Tom Kha Gai, which comes in a bowl sitting on top of a pot with a burning ember. Also had a broccoli dish, which was fresh, crisp & tender, and not too saucy.

Very, very small place, but they'll take your cell phone number and call you when a table's open.
author: Stacy J.

description:
While visiting a friend and new mommy in the bay area, we ordered some take out from this Thai place.  She and her hubby eat here on a fairly regular basis.

Since each person at the get-together picked one dish, we had a wide range of foods to eat including Tom Yum Kai and Pad Thai.  I have to say that I found everything to be flavorful and tasty.
author: Bob C.

description:
I used to come here when I lived in the same building in which the business operated.  I marveled how I could be baking brownies at home, doing laundry at the laundromat, and eating at a Thai restaurant all in the same building.  God, I love San Francisco.

Anyway, Tawan's has excellent, home made Thai food at reasonable prices.  The restaurant is very small and only has about five tables, which makes it perfect for couples or small groups.  It's charmingly decorated with the art of the owner's young son, Tawan.  Everyone working there seems to be family and they're all competent and attentive.  When you ask for spicy, they don't screw around, which made me instantly fond of them.  My only complaint is that they don't give you as much food as other local eateries.  If you aren't a pig like myself though, that's probably a good thing.
author: Daniel F.

description:
I have issues and one of those issues is that I hate people.  Misanthropy can be inconvenient in social situations so I try not to leave the house much.  That said, I've tried out every Thai delivery in the inner and outer richmond and Tawan's was immediately recognizable as the best Thai food brought to my door.

Stuff I'd never seen before:
Thung Thong.  Miscellaneous ground stuff (chicken, potatoes, onions, etc) with curry powder wrapped in rice paper and then deep fried.  Damned good.

Goong Gra-Borg.  Marinated shrimp and bacon wrapped in rice paper and deep fried.  Served with plum sauce.  Bacon really does make everything better.

All the other standard Thai dishes I tried were excellent as well.  I have yet to check out the larb. Not that I particularly love larb, but I think it's the best name for a food EVER.  Besides, how can you go wrong with ground pork?

I just found out last week that a girl I know is Tawan's cousin and that really is him who delivers food sometimes.
author: Umetaro J.

description:
I cannot believe I have not written a review about this amazing place. I love eating Tawan because the food and service is EXCELLENT!! Every item that I ordered was always good. I like their spiciness index. When I want it really spicy--it is actually really spicy! I love that.

Also this place does not get crowded which I love. I do not like eating at a crowded restaurant. At the same time it is not empty.

The art and craft are cute.

EAT HERE!
author: Chatree T.

description:
No reason to be mean. Very cute little, hole in the wall Thai restaurant. Tawan is the son of the owners. He likes to draw...his art is all over the restaurant, even in the menu. Tawan gets five stars for his artwork!
The food. Not good, just OK for Farang.
Fried chicken wings for a starter. Bland. Marnee Thai rates a 10.
Both Curry dishes were uninspired and sloppy. Osha rates a 10.
White rice was old.
The PadThai was decent, but nothing to write Bangkok about.
Asked for all dishes to be spicy. All came back with minimal kick. 
Thai Nazi in food court at Rincon rates far better. You order now!
Wouldn't return.
author: Mr. S.

description: So finally got back here and was not dissapointed.  Had the sautéed chicken #41 and red curry with Pumpkin curry.  We got take out and was fast and reasonably priced.
author: Hawk M.

description:
I've been going to Tawan's since I can remember--getting close to a decade now. It's by far my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco. Unpretentious and well priced, the food is as good as it gets.

If you like spicy food, Tawan's is for you. Early on, they'd provide a disclaimer to non-Thai's ordering their food "hot," recommending you start at medium and get it more spicy next time if you wanted. The few times I've been brave enough to order my food hot, it's turned me into that red sweaty guy in the corner--the mango salad made me cry. If you appreciate Thai food, you know that in SE Asia, spice is where it's at. The hotter the better. Tawan's does it in true Thai tradition.

If spice isn't your thing, they make a mean pad thai. The cornish game hen is also always a winning choice. The thung thong (pronounced tung-tong), an appetizer of minced chicken, potatoes, carrots and curry sauce fried in a won-ton wrapper, is brilliant. But then again, so are most things on the menu. Try it and enjoy!
author: Nelson R.

description: So far so good.  I lived a block away from the place and wanted to stop in but never had the chance.  Now that I'm living somewhere else I made myself go.  If I could I'd slap myself in the face a year ago, this place is great!  The food is so good, and in good portion.  They also deliver!
author: Jesse C.

description:
Their food is excellent. The flavors are delicious. Their spicy means SPICY!  Try the excellent Panaeng Gai Yarng which is a curry dish with white meat chicken, mushroom, bell pepper, and red curry in coconut milk. The charming artwork of Tawan,
 the owner's son graces the restaurant walls. They also deliver.
author: chris m.

description:
3.5 stars

Tawan's is a teensy hole-in-the-wall in the Inner Richmond.  Come here for fast Thai at very reasonable prices!

The bf and I went for dinner last Friday and weren't feeling particularly famished.  We settled on the tom yum with chicken, a broccoli dish, and a cucumber salad.  The disappointing thing about the broccoli dish was that there was a black hair in it when it was served to us....

It's not spectacular food, but it will satisfy your Thai cravings and won't likely break your budget.
author: Kira K.

description:
Based on one weeknight delivery.  

The food was 2.5 stars, but I'm rounding up because 1) they used really nice plastic containers, 2) nothing spilled over the edges of the containers, the bag in which our food was placed was nice and dry, 3) there was a LOT of sauce in the curry beef that I could drizzle over rice for two subsequent meals.

I was quite excited to order from here because of the ratings it has received thus far.  However, maybe their take-out is less tasty than dine-in, because all our food was quite bland.  They LOOKED pretty and fresh and flavorful, but each item was lacking flavor.  

Red curry beef: my husband says it's very very average.  I enjoyed the curry sauce, but I also found it lacked zing.

Pad Thai with chicken: it looked really nice, but it was a tad too sweet.

Pineapple fried rice: my dish.  The portion was not very big - I ate it in one sitting.  It was nice, but it lacked some bite to it, I can't quite describe it.

Papaya salad: quite heavy on the garlic.  I think this might have been the best out of all four dishes.

Total was $38 not including tip.  

Unfortunately my husband says he will not order from here anymore.  I would give it another chance myself, probably by dining in for lunch one day to see if there's a difference btwn eating in and out.

Good presentation and care in packaging, but lacked flavor.
author: Mrs F.

description:
This place is cute, yes I said cute. And the waitress is sooo nice, but is Tawan the one doing the cooking?

Flavors are week and too simple. Like maybe I should just eat some raw basil and chilies.
author: Lee M.

description:
Unbelievable!! We do weekly catering for 90+ people per week and was invited into Tawans for a "tasting". We taste food at a variety of restaurants and then write them checks for over $600 a week worth of food if we are happy with the fare. When we sat down, we made it very clear that we only want small tasting of about 7 items to see which are best for our customers. 

We waited an incredibly long time to be served, despite the three people at the table next to us making the net sum of the  patrons 5 people. 

The food was decent, but not amazing. Certainly good enough to use for our catering job though, considering the price point.

At the end We thanked them and as we were walking out, they waved a check for over $50 to us! Thats tough to do for 2 people when the average price of a dish is around $7! FYI: no booze or other extras purchased to jack up the tab.

When I approached the young man serving me about this, he told me that he had to charge me and that the owners were not there. I agreed to pay, if it would be a deposit for the big delivery. He said yes. As I walked through the kitchen to the bathroom, I noticed that the woman in the kitchen cooking was also the woman in the picture of their cute menu. The picture of the owners.

They charged us full price for dishes that were sample portions, and reneged on their offer to have us in for a complimentary tasting. 

Of course, they didn't respond to me and never called back to set up the food delivery. I can't say I am sorry to have spent my $600+ at another restaurant for my clients this week: Teriyaki house of Brisbane. Very nice, and not crooks!
author: Jud Y.

description: Very good bad ooooh did the curry do a number on me!
author: Y S.

description:
Okay anyone who has given this place a bad review needs to head on down to their doctor and get themselves checked..asap!
if you like thai food, this place is the spot..the bf and i went here after i yelped it on my Iphone.my foodian adventurous bf is always down to try something yummy and new. it is very delicious. we had the chicken wings for appetizer.yum! tasty, cooked to perfection in some sauce. we then had three plates..some brocoli beef thing, some shrimp and noodle thing (yum!) and some shrimp and veggie thing..so scrumptous and tasty :) 

the little pictures in the menu are super cute (my bf even thought so lol) and the service was good..my bf loved the sauce they used on the chicken.so much that he poured it on the other dishes they gave us haha ..the  nice waitress accepted us and our weird food loving habits such as what he did...this place is a hidden treasure
author: Mariangeles C.

description:
Bingo!!! If you're looking for AWESOME thai food, then search no more!!! Tawan's is the superest. The fiance and I had the fried curry catfish, chicken lard nar and  the full of yummy goodness crepe and we were beyond satisfied. 

The prices were well worth the quality of food. The service was a little on the slow side, but they don't lose any stars for that because they were super busy (we went during the dinner rush) and you could tell the staff was doing the best that they could. Our waitress never missed any of our requests, despite the hectic environment.

Oh yeah, and like what everyone else said - the decor is a sight to see. If you don't go for the food, then simply stopping by to view their cute menu and neat artwork is an absolute must!
author: MrBoomBastic ..

description:
Tawan's makes an excellent pad see ew with tofu and since the quality of that dish is how I determine the quality of all Thai restaurants, I think Tawan's is excellent as well. They also let you bring in beers from the liquor store right next door which is killer.
I've also liked all of the curries that I've tried and their satay.

It is a tiny little place so if you're looking to have an intimate conversation, expect to do so with the 15 other people in the restaurant. The last time I was there a woman came in by herself, sat down, and looked like she was going to burst into tears before she even ordered. In fact she literally ran out of the restaurant before the waitress could get to her. A half an hour later she came back to see if she'd left her book at her table and when she couldn't find it I thought she was going to fall over and die right there in the middle of the place.

My friends and I all agreed that if you're having a shitty day, you should just get takeout from Tawan's and not sit there by yourself unless you want the rest of the restaurant to speculate on why you're so depressed. Their pad see ew is mighty comforting though.
author: stephanie c.

description: Great Thai Food in the Richmond!  This place is one of my absolute favorites in SF.  They get it all so right, it actually tastes like food in Thailand.  Love their papaya salad, soups, curries, everything is yummmy.  This is a family business that cares about serving you quality food.  They even deliver in the area.  Most of the people giving this place poor review don't have a clue what they are talking about.  For example, Pad Thai is not supposed to come out spicy; instead, Thai people add their preferred spice level on top with chili flakes and such.  And I don't get the service complaints, this is a very small restaurant that is well staffed and attentive, but I guess if the service isn't American enough you can always hit up Osha and pay double for less authentic dishes.
author: Chris T.

description:
Yumm-o. I ordered dinner for delivery and the food came fast and piping hot! The pad thai was delicious and appropriately tangy with lots of chicken and tofu, the angel wings were crisp and full of filling with a nice sweet & spicy dipping sauce, and the silver noodle soup was homestyle and comforting on a cold Friday night. 
The portions are just right and the quality is great. Its my new go to thai delivery joint for now!
author: Stacy T.

description:
Cute concept, agree about the "ehh" food.

Ordered 79 - rolls & 71 - noodles with chicken, along with a can of sprite.  I think came to about $15, so decent price.

Rolls were good, it would be sad if they weren't. 
The noodles were eh though - I liked the egg mixed in, but overall thought the portion was kind of small.

Also they use styrofoam = bad!

I like Little Thai better.
author: laura g.

description:
Very cute place to eat! 

I saw Tawan in the rest. Altho hes all grown up now, its a very creative and cute place to eat. I went here with a group of friends and on a date before, its a place that gives you a lot to talk and look at--you can even buy a drawing of Tawan's if you want! 

The food is great, affordable and taste pretty fresh. 

Its really small but very cozy and cute, the staff is really nice!
author: Amy S.

description:
Okay, people. Why is this place close to empty every time my PIC (partner in crime) and I come for dinner? 
The tom kha gai is freaking perfect (and spicy!), the curries are complex (imagine!), all the veggies are so fresh it feels like their mommies must still be sad they're gone, and they actually stray a bit outside the typical set of thai standards to serve things you can't get in every thai joint in town. I think if the staff was any nicer I'd try to get them to adopt me. Parking's even easy. I am so confused that this place isn't swamped that I feel like intervention is in order.

Because, you see, PIC and I can only eat so much. Come on - do your part. Reward their culinary skills, creativity, and whimsy! If Tawan (who is certainly a teenager, and who is usually in the restaurant at night playing with a Gameboy) can handle having his parents plaster their whole restaurant with his adorable (read: probably acutely embarrassing to a teenager) childhood drawings of "Squidy" and "Popnail" for your amusement, the least you can do is eat their yummy food.
author: Elle B.

description:
charming, little restaurant with 6 tables and owner's son, tawan's, childhood artwork on the walls and in the menu. i usually get the sauteed ground chicken and basil over rick-stick noodle when i come here for a late lunch (very tasty and only $7). think i'll try the crab cake the next time i return.

*EDIT 8/5/07*: returned for dinner on a Saturday night. the place was packed. we arrived as a table was leaving so the four of us were quickly seated but service was super slow. it took an hour for our entrees to arrive, but the food was delicious. crab cakes were tasty but glistening with oil. papaya salad was very good but tongue burning spicy although we specified mild for spiciness. loved the shrimp, calamari and eggplant curry. the only non-winner was the overcooked sauteed beef with mushroom.
author: Diana B.

description: This place didn't live up to expectations... food is mediocre at best and definitely not impressive.
author: Ayall S.

description:
I like this place a lot - despite that it brings back some deep memories of certain people......I digress, excuse me...where was I??? 

It would not stop me from coming back to this place.  I like the homey feel, I like the home cooked food better and I like the people who work there. 

It is hard to find parking at times. I would not suggest parking in the bank parking next door even though I have done it myself from time to time. And the artwork done by their kid is so cute.....yes I said cute.  I like it - especially with every where trying to be sophisticated and what not. That's nice sometimes but when you just want some really great tasting food I could care less whether the lighting is just right or whether the chairs are backed with velvet. Trust me you - when I'm some where for an eating experience all of that is the last thing on my mind and my stomach's mind. 
Good is good, and this place is GREAT!

Is there much else to really say?
author: John-Michael C.

description:
What a cute hole-in-the-wall Thai place! Judging from the outside you wouldn't think this place will serve quality Thai food, but the food (and prices) were excellent!  The menu offered plenty of curry, seafood, and noodle dishes, but I don't think you can go wrong with any of them.  

We started off with the egg roll appetizer-- freshly fried and very hot; the Gaeng Khiaw-warn-- chicken in green curry and coconut milk with bamboo shoot, bell pepper and fresh basil-- which wasn't too soupy because there was so much substance to it;  the Pad Makheur Yao--  sauteed calamari with eggplant, chili, onion, bell pepper and basil-- I loved the eggplant and the calamari pieces were huge; and the Lard-nar--  pan-fried noodle with gravy sauce, broccoli and sliced chicken.  This was plenty for 3 people, and we even had leftovers for to-go.  

I sat facing the kitchen and it seems like the cook carefully and freshly prepare the dishes as the order is taken.  Being the observant person that I am, I noticed that they received many delivery calls.  So along with taking care of the dine-in customers, they also have to prepare the delivery orders.  Which probably explained why it took awhile for the waiter to bring us the check.  It didn't help that there was only one waiter.  Nonetheless, the affordable, succulent dishes made up for it.  

Only down side: it's a tiny place, so it's not recommended for big groups.
author: Lisa C.

description:
5 Stars for Tawan's. Here's why:

-The food and service is always good. 
-We never have to wait for a table.
-Parking around here is very manageable. 
-Prices are extremely reasonable for a nice meal in this cute little restaurant. 
-When they say spicy, they mean spicy.

Tawan's is an easy decision when we're hungry for Thai food. Mmm.. mmm... good!
author: Vitamin C.

description:
Went here last night and got some take out. I would overall say that yes, I would go back... just not sure how often.

Tawan's is a tiny little thai joint on Geary....

The food?  Not bad at all. 
The price? Not bad at all either. 
The portions? Pretty average.

Inside, not only do they serve food, but they sell little do-da's of jewelry. Bracelets, necklaces, etc.

Anyway, if you are looking for a thai joint in the Richmond I would recommend coming here. We only got the chicken yellow curry and the pork in blackbean garlic sauce over sauteed veggies (just carrots and cabbage).. it was tasty, but seemed more like a chinese dish or something.. but then again, a lot of asian foods overlap / offer the same or similar dishes. Anyway, I'm excited for another day when I'm lazy to cook and crave thai food close by so I can try some other dishes!
author: Kimberly F.

description:
The delivery is always quick, always tasty, and always tempting when I don't want to cook. 

I have enjoyed everything I've ordered off the menu here. The curries, appetizers, and soup- rocks. If they deliver to where you live, stop reading and order some goodness.
author: C S.

description:
Perfect for what it is.

We were wandering around out of our usual area, and decided to check this place out on a whim.  Ok, actually on a hunger pang.

The menu was super cool, with cutesy artwork and a story behind it.  I bet the artist's friends are super impressed with his fame now that he's in high school.

The food was delicious, the service was great.  Unpretentious, charming, tasty, and filling.  Just how I like my "random restaraunt I walked by and decided to eat at."
author: Gusty S.

description: Their food seems better recently. I went in for lunch and got the pad thai. Much better. I did not order the curry so can't comment if the sauce had gotten thicker, but I will be returning when I am in town. 4.5 stars
author: Jessica F.

description:
i can't say much about the venue or the ambiance since i got take-out and i can't really attest to the service since my boyfriend was the one who went to pick up the food, but i can tell you about the food!

DELICIOUS!!!  YUMMY!!!  FANTASTIC!!!

can't wait to go back for more : )
author: cindy c.

description: "on vacation", but of course they don't announce this on Yelp. You have to come all the way to see the sign on the door.
author: Oren R.

description: Been eating here about once a month for the last 15 years.  Having tried Thai restaurants all over the country this place makes the best tom yum soup out of all of them. Their red curry is good. This place can really make their food spicy so be careful not to ask for extra spicy if ur not up for it. Even regular spicy is hot here. Tum yum gai soup is must try!
author: Vin R.

description:
I didn't have terribly high expectations when I came coming off of a mediocre experience at Thai Time near Clement St.  However, Tawan's did not disappoint at all!  I highly recommend:

- the stuffed angel wings
- sauteed beef and split green beans with basil
- charbroiled pork skewers with sweet & sour sauce
- shrimp, calamari and pineapple fried rice

It was all so excellent (totally packed with flavor), I will be back within the next three days!  Surprisingly enough, there was only one other party there at 8pm on a Saturday night.  The delivery business seemed to be busy with the driver coming back around at least 3 times during our meal.

As many others have mentioned, the menu and walls are cutely decorated with Tawan's hand drawn pictures.  The interior is quite small, but can probably be reconfigured to accomodate parties of 6-8.

In closing, great food, great value, great service...  I rate it a "must try."
author: Howard H.

description:
Tawan's...good authentic Thai food in a hole-in-the-wall location. I've been here a few times and wanted to give it a fair review. People don't come here for the ambiance like they do at Osha Thai. People come to Tawan's for the delicious authentic Thai food.

The curries here are all absolutely delicious!

WARNING!!!! Their spicy is definitely mouth-watering-saliva-engaging-milk-needing kinda HOT!!! It had me sweating up a storm, my nose, and eyes watering. Now I can eat spicy..but good lord, this stuff is not for the faint of heart! 

The service is always nice, the food is always good! It's a great place to sneak away for a quiet meal, but beware if you are looking for this place,....driving by, don't blink, you just might miss it! But make those 3 right hand turns and find parking, because Tawan's is DEFINITELY worth it!

4 Yummerz stars from me!!!
author: Ann T.

description:
Me and my co-worker found this place on yelp and this has been our place to go ever since. We always leave satisfied and happy.  Tawan is the teenage kid sitting in the back table doing deliveries now. The drawings you see on the menus and walls are drawn by him back when he was 'little' Tawan. I see him playing with his DS half of the time and tempted to challenge him one-on-one, one of these days!

I would recommend their Papaya Salad (the 'hot' made my co-worker cry), Silver Noodle Soup, Panaeng Gai Yarng (Chicken skewers w/Mushrooms & Bell Peppers, finished off w/Red Curry) , Gaeng Daeng (Choice of Chicken, Beef or Pork w/ Bamboo Shoots & Curry) & Mango Sweet Sticky Rice. 

Their 'spicy' is SUPER spicy!! So, we usually stick with mild. It has just the right amount of spiciness to it, which doesn't take away from the goodness of the food. *drools*

Super cute place and very friendly waiter. Food might take a while to arrive, but it has always been well worth the wait. I'd rather they take the time to 'perfect' their food than having to rush.

This place rulez!!!
author: Serena W.

description:
The very first thing you notice about this place is the size. It's gotta be just a tiny bit bigger then my bedroom (the front of it anyway)...so not a great place to go with more that 4 people...

But, if it's just you and a date, or a friend or two....you can't go wrong with Tawan's! I really love that this place is BYOB, I'm not sure if I've ever seen that in a Thai food place before...but that's cool....just means I know that I can have Newcastle with my Thai food. 

Apparently, that really is Tawan...probably about 16 or 17 now...I guess he delivers the food now...wonder how he feels seeing all his drawings of when he was younger all over (also now available as a t-shirt!)

So, back to the real review, the food. OMG! This place is excellent! Sometimes, when they say they're going to make it spicy, they don't really. So, when I ordered my soup medium, the waitress told me that would make it pretty spicy...I thought it was perfect...a little to spicy for Laura...but she's a wimp :)  My main dish was some slices of beef on a bed of vegetables...this I ordered "Hot", and I must say that it did live up to the billing! That was soooooooo hot! But sooooo damn good! 

I will be going back fo' shizzle. 

And so should you.
author: Matthew S.

description:
I went with a friend, She had Yellow Curry w/ Chicken (Gaeng Ga-Ree Gai) and I had and I had a Beef,Mushroom,Green Bean, and Baby Corn sizzling platter (Neur Ga-Ta) We Also ordered some Rice, The food was good and the atmosphere of the restaurant was nice, The Kid Drawings were what caught our attention first. Anyways our food arrived It was pretty good Thai food, the waitress was very curteous and the servings were filling. We also ordered dessert, Mango and Sticky Rice and Thai Pancake w/ Condensed milk. The Sticky Rice was very Fragrant and the Mango was...perfect, best mango I've ever had. The Pancake was warm and delicious and cheap, it went well with the sticky rice and mango.

Overall this seems like a good place to just grab some Thai food, the menu is huge so I suggest taking a menu with you if you plan to return. They have a wide vegetarian selection as well.
author: Bruce W.

description:
Tawan's Thai is my new favorite Thai restaurant.  I find food here fresher and more authentic than Marnee's (my old love).

The place is very small with only 6 tables.  It's definitely a family run place so when it gets busy the service can be a bit slow, but they're really friendly and helpful.  The ambiance isn't bad.  The interior color is warm yellow  with kids drawings hanging on the walls.  It's small, but a cute place.

Curry dishes, stir-fried ground pork with beans, fried rice, papaya salad are all really good.  

This place deserves a 4.5!
author: Paul K.

description:
I finally got a chance to come here. Thank you yelpers for another good recommendation! Laura L. and I were starving and I knew that anything Thai is going to go well for a Friday.  I've been trying to find the "gold bag" appetizer that I ate in Thailand...dang...the Goong Gra-bor wasn't it, but still a very good substitute plus anything with sweet Thai sauce is going to be good (my new ketchup).  I could have tried anything on the extensive menu, but we usually judge a Thai place by the quality of their pad thai and it was Excellent!
The plating was unique, they put the fresh soy beans on the side for you to mix in yourself.  The noodles were not greasy and the tofu & shrimp was plump.

Service was brisk and nice, I love the drawings on the menu and walls. It's going to be tight if you have a huge group as there's only 6 4-seat tables. Cozy but absolutely adorable. 

One thing to remember in this neighborhood is that parking is a blood fest. It's the ---take-no prisoners, bust-your-best-friend's knee cap, bamboo-shivving in the eyes---stench of desperation type of parking that only should be given to driver's test kids as a sadomasochist's guilty pleasure.
author: Pauline L.

description:
Tawan's is a nice little hole in the wall with a creative flair both in it's decor and on the menu. I like the silly little drawings on the walls and the fact that they sell t-shirts is also cool. This is the closest Thai restaurant near my house so I felt it was  my duty to try it out. 

I ordered a beef dish with green beans and red peppers. It was nicely prepared and the 'spicy' level was appropriate. I requested it mild and it came out mild. The Pad Thai was also tasty. My buddy ordered the curry chicken and he made the mistake of getting it extra spicy, because it made eating the dish difficult. It's no fun when you have to drink a gallon of water because your mouth is on fire. Trust me I know. 

Overall Tawan's is a cute little place that will get a return visit from me soon or possibly take out.
author: Eric B.

description: I just had some for dinner last night. I'm always amazed that it's never full despite how good the food is. We both were "dreaming" about pumpkin curry, so that was a must. Staff(I think they are all family) are always so nice and it's just a comfy and solid Thai restaurant in this area. Enjoy :D
author: Megumi S.

description:
Enh, its ok.
My brother likes ordering from here, not my favorite.
author: Tom S.

description: This place came extremely highly recommended by Asian food-foodies, so I knew I was in for a treat. They ordered and everything was very tasty. I especially liked the veggie purses appetizer. All the veggies (esp green beans) in all of the dishes were fresh, and the sauces light and tasty. The place was cute and small, and the prices right. It is the bomb!
author: Andrew K.

description: One thing definitely you will enjoy in this place is the atmosphere. I just love the homey feeling in a restaurant.....makes you feel better you know? And definitely makes the food better too! The drawings in the menu is also really cute. Food wise......I think its pretty good, they offered the types of spiciness which is always a plus for me so i can decide the spiciness of the food. I ordered the green curry and it was just as i expected.
author: Cavin T.

description:
This place is not only SUPER CUTE, everything was just all around really really good!  

The walls are yellow, and the door sign looks like its hand made.  I'm a sucker for homey places because it just gives the restaurant so much character.  I almost feel like I'm special because I know about a great restaurant that others don't know about.  So much for that secret now that I'm writing this review eh?  

Tom Kha Gai was really really good.  I always get this when I go to a new Thai place because I'm trying to find the restaurant that makes this the best.  Although the portion was kind of small compared to what I'm used it, at least I wasn't overstuffed and feeling like ass after I left!  

Thai Iced Tea was not too milky/creamy tasting.  Just good.  
Their regular hot Thai Tea (with unlimited refills) was really really good, too!  

My friend's Pad Thai was also quite delicious.  Good amount of sauce, not too try.  At least four or five large shrimps!  I swear, other Thai restaurants only give like two!  

I'm DEFINITELY going back here again.  Screw you King of Thai noodle with mean mean waiters that bring your check half way through your meal.  I'll never willingly go back to you again!
author: Anna T.

description: This was typically my first time actually going around SF. The place we originally we were going to eat was closed so we went here instead. We were the only ones in the restaurant, but it was pretty cozy. It's a small place, and customer service was good. The waiter was helpful about question we had about the menu and recommendations. Although because we were starving from not eating in a long time... the anticipation of waiting for them to make our meals felt like forever. When we finally received our appetizer papaya salad it was gone to quickly! But it was a good dish to start us off. The sauce they had for it was a perfect combination of sour and sweet. When we finally received our dishes we were ecstatic to try them. After trying each other's plates, we were all pretty much satisfied with the taste of each one. The curry was delicious, as well their noodles. Overall I thought this place was good thai food place.
author: Mary D.

description: Darling Tawan's is a place that I value simply because of the good food and vibes that emanate from this place. The food is spicy and made with care. This is one of the few Thai places that I will always come back too.
author: Brian J.

description: Great pad see ew, modern designed interior, very quick service. Bathroom is average, but there's no real ventilation into the place. That was the one caveat. It can get steaming hot in there on a hot day. Bonus points for being close to our hotel.
author: Henry T.

description: This place is small and cozy and has some of the best Thai food I have had in San Francisco!  Everything tastes really fresh and it seems very thoughtfully prepared.  I am glad I found this little gem.
author: Alice G.

description:
I was wanting to give it a 4.5 but I can't so I just rounded up. The food at Marnee might be a little bit better (barely) but the ambiance at Tawan's is better so they equal out.

The decor is so damn cute, I can't get over. Quite hip I have to say. The yellow walls with Tawan's drawings framed provides a very happy feeling. Even better because it's not some hipsters trying to look cool but drawings from a real kid.  Plus the place is small, only 6 tables. 

The waitress is always unfailingly nice; water and tea are constantly filled. The food is pretty awesome, flavors are great. The fried catfish in red curry with lightly fried basil, wow. Their curry is pretty heavy on the coconut cream, just how I like it. One of my companions loved the fact that they service fresh coconut juice, in a coconut! 

And they deliver! It's only 4 blocks from my house but on game nights, delivery can be crucial. I've never seen it full, which is weird since it's so good.
author: Salina Z.

description:
I would consider this place a hole in the wall type of restaurant. My roommate recommended it to me and her approval of the restaurant didn't fail me when I tried their food. 

Tawan's is a cute little restaurant where their menus are covered with drawings made by a child and their tables are sewn with similar pictures from the menus. Looking at the menu I thought, "damn, I was never that artistic when I was child". Nonetheless, it was small and fitting for a cozy, at home, type of meal. The food is light and doesn't overload you with grease. The best part is that you don't have to chug multiple glasses of water from the large amounts of MSG that most Asian restaurants put in your food. Another good thing is that it's reasonable priced. Want to expand your horizon and try something other than the over-glorified King of Thai? Go for Tawan's and be inspired to open your own restaurant when you have kids and they decide to doodle during dinner.
author: Jensine R.

description:
After my wife was bemoaning the fact that there wasn't a Thai restaurant to her liking around us, she was delighted to find this place on Yelp.

As you probably know from reading other reviews, the place is named after the owner's son.  I thought it was a wonderful concept to have the kid's drawings put into the menu, framed on the wall and even put as part of the table cloth.  It really did feel like a mom & pop restaurant, but one of the highest quality.

Plus when the actual Tawan (now almost a decade older than when he originally drew the pictures) came in, my wife and I huddled together, began whispering and made furtive glances over like he was some kind of celebrity.  Brilliant!
