Anyway, we were not in anyway disappointed in our food.  My wife stuck the the basics:  pad thai.  I picked a dish with eggplant and chicken that was amazing.  We're definitely looking forward to going back and exploring the menu more.

A word of advice though... the place is BYOB but luckily there's a corner store next door where you can buy a beer if you want.
author: Ben C.

description:
I'm not quite sure why this place is nearly empty every time I come here. It's a small, cozy place. The decor is creative and unique, yet down-to-earth. The whole "Tawan" theme (the restaurant is named after the owner's son, who as a child also drew all the drawings on the wall in in the menu) makes coming here a fun experience--just ignore the fact that Tawan the boy is like 16 years old now and chilling at the table in the back; no longer the little boy in the menu. 

For some reason, most of the customers I see walking through Tawan are take-out customers. The food is pretty good! Thai cuisine can be so similar at times, but the dishes at Tawan are really fresh, and I'm a big fan of their Tom Yum (or whatever the coconut milk soup is called).
author: Edmund C.

description: First time ordering Tawan's. After reading the other Yelp reviews, this looked like one of the best delivery thai places in the Inner Richmond. The delivery was super quick, coming to me in under 20 minutes! Unfortunately, this was the only impressive thing about my experience. The Pad See Ew I ordered had a good sauce to noodle ratio, but the pork was super dry and stringy and the noodles had been burnt so the whole meal sort of fell apart. I also ordered the Pad Broccoli with beef, which contained soggy veggies and loose watery sauce at the bottom that didn't have much flavor. Perhaps eating at the restaurant would have given me better results, but I'm going to stay away from this place from now on!
author: Caroline B.

description: I've been ordering food from this place for almost 22 years (calling on the way home & it's done by the time I get there!) & I can't say enough good things about Tawan's. It's run by Lek & Kak (wife, chef & husband, a little bit of everything), from Thailand, natch. Clean, extensive menu, quality produce + fish etc. Food's fantastic. Windows add space + light. Even during the worst of the recent/current recession, this place was/is packed every night. My favorites: salmon curry with a pinch of spicy + fried rice w/vegetables (Total: $24.75 + tip). Sometimes I add a side of something green (broccoli sp?) w/garlic + scoop(s) of coconut ice cream. (If you can't eat spicy food, make sure you repeat that until the, mostly, Thai waiters understand. No spice or spice is about your choices.)  Kind, smart people who create a cozy atmosphere. No flat screens on the wall here! Parking's easy along Geary w/o too much effort. It's first-come, first served. Mostly busy by 7:30 p.m., but not much wait. Take out and delivery (if close by) too. After dinner, enjoy a 1-block walk across Geary to Clement St., turn right a few blocks for Green Apple Books or a stroll or turn left at Clement for Walgreens and sports bars with those big flat screens (if there's a game you just gotta see). Safe walking neighborhood at night, just be aware - like anywhere. Clean and one of the top places in the neighborhood, food-quality wise. Enjoy.
author: susan m.

description:
This little hole in the wall is such a delightful treat! The service was attentive, quick and food was delicious.  The menu is super cute with the little drawings & gave it a nice family oriented feel.  

I don't normally like curry dishes too much, but the eggplant chicken one we ordered was delicious, the eggplant nicely cooked so that it wasn't gooey & over cooked.  The chicken was nice and moist, not dried out like some places tend to have.  The pad thai was delicious, nicely spiced and came with big plump shrimp.  YUM. 

Definitely coming back here!!
author: Lulu C.

description:
Tawan Tawan....Such a beautiful name.  If I hadn't seen your picture I would have only thought of you as a great Thai restaurant on Geary.  But it turns out that you are more than that.  You are actually the kid that inspired this establishment by your parents.  

Your drawings on the nicely laid out menus brings me great delight as does the Salmon Curry that I had for dinner.  Not only did the curry taste good but it was at a reasonable price for a seafood related dish.  

I have to say that I am not surprised since many have told me how great the food is.  Thank you Tawan.  Thank you for motivating the establishment of this great Thai restaurant.
author: Alan T.

description:
Got take out from here last week and it was really good. When you say you want it Extra Spicy they makes it Extra FUCKING Spicy!! I got the Eggplant and Chicken antd it was delish with some coconut and tomato flavors up in there. My hubby got a noodle dish with chicken I think it was the Pad Graw something. It lacked sauce and flavor but he was aiiight after I hooked him up with some soy sauce. The egg rolls were too tiny and you get only three for $5.95 Give them a chance for take-out it is worth it.

Funny thing in a romantic gesture on the hubby's part he came out with a take-out container that was filled with cheesy school girl bracelet.  He was beaming from ear to ear and so proud that he not only ordered dinner but he got me well ummm some Thai Bling...Now I am a Tiffany's kind of girl but seeing the cute look on his face I accepted his gift with a smile and threw it in the back seat never to be seen again. (wink..wink) It was a sweet gesture but this SISTAH does not wear Thai bling...
author: T H.

description:
Why was Tawans not the first restaurant I reviewed?  I have no idea.  My friends have been asking me why I haven't reviewed it seeing as how this is the first place I always suggest when they want to go out for dinner or take some friends to a good Thai restaurant.   Of course there are many good Thai restaurants in the city, but this one is above all the absolute best.  

First, the restaurant is named after Tawan, the owners' son.  When I first started eating here, he was a little guy whose drawings covered the walls and menu.  Now you can buy his art, framed or on a t-shirt, and he is nowhere near as little as he once was.  He goes on the deliveries now.  

Second, the service at Tawan's is awesome.  They are so friendly and helpful that it hurts.   When you come in, they immediately say hello with a genuine smile and sit you right away (if you are so lucky to show up when they are not full).  Because they do not sell any beer wine or liquor, you can easily walk the 10 steps back to the corner store for some beer or wine and bring it back in.  I've brought 40's in and it's been totally cool.  

Third,  the food is delicious.  I can't even being to go into deta- okay fine.  When I order for delivery or pick up (sadly I can only pick up now because I live in the sunset) I have the old standby order of Pad Sub Nok with beef, which is ground beef sauteed with julienned green beans and all kinds of good spice, the panaeng curry with chicken, and usually the Thung Thong as an appetizer.  That has all kinds of good spices and textures to it.  

They offer different levels of spice.  If you like spicy food, go medium spicy.  The spicy is really spicy.  it's manageable to those who like spicy food, however, if you think you like spicy food but have never been truly tested, be careful.
author: Charley B.

description:
Thai food that delivers in my neighborhood.  Way too good.

Food portion sizes could be a tad bigger, but its not a big deal.

The real reason why I like them is that they have their menu on Yelp via their pictures - genius!
author: Qyon G.

description:
So I love Tawan's because they deliver.  My roommate habitually orders the same thing and now the nice lady that owns the place remembers his order as soon as he gives them our address. 

I always order the Stuffed Chicken wings - it's a deboned giant chicken wing stuff with pork, clear noodles, lichen and other goodies and served with a sweet and sour chili sauce.  My other faves are the Pad Thai, Silver Noodle Soup, and now they added the Shrimp Spring rolls to their menu.  The currys especially the pumpkin curry is good too.

My roommate always orders the Penang Beef and he says it's really the best compared to other places he has tried.  He literally does a happy "Tawan" dance when we finally get our food delivered and no, my roommate is actually an adult and not 12 years old. 

They are a small family run place and the food is always consistent.  Love them!  Tawan himself even does the deliveries sometimes :-)
author: Tamikasan L.

description: Seriously infested with cockroaches. Don't eat here. Really.
author: neal j.

description: I f*@$ing love this place! I love that when you say spicy-really spicy they make it really spicy. This is what I normally order there: spicy chicken wings with the chili sauce, pad see ewe and the panang curry. The larb and tom yum are good too. The customer service is great. I am always satisfied when I eat here, it really hits the spot when you're craving Thai food. It's grubbin'........Also, I like the cover of the to go menu, it's so cute.
author: Lin L.

description: We used to live in the Inner Richmond and Tawan's was our go-to Thai place. What a treat. Everything on their menu is absolutely delicious...probably the best Thai food that I've ever had (and I've had a lot of Thai). Now we live in Oakland and the Thai place in our hood is subpar at best...definitely miss the freshness and originality of Tawan's.
author: M J.

description:
When accounting for quality, taste, and price -- this is my FAVORITE thai restaurant in the Inner Richmond!!!  I know there are many thai places to choose from in the IR...and trust me...I've tried most....but Tawan's never disappoints.  The ingredients are fresh and high quality, the portions are large, a take out order is always ready within 10 minutes, dishes are alway hot, staff is friendly, prices are reasonable, and the shop is cozy with unique character....and if you are lazy, they will even deliver!!

THIS IS A MUST TRY!

I recommend Pad Sei Ew (however do you spell...?) beef or chicken
Pumpkin Curry with Chicken
Some skewered chicken dish w/ red curry - don't know the name...
Green Curry 

k, thanks
author: M J.

description: eating the best pad kee mow I've had in sf. Even better than regent (my fave usually).
author: Evan B.

description:
Great Thai place. Curries are the best in that area. This is the spot to have Thai food when you are in this area.  My other favorite is in Bernal Heights at "PAD THAI".  The only i thing I've noticed was the Iced tea is too sweet for me sometimes.
The presentation and the helping size is really good for the price.  It's very inexpensive for Thai food of this quality.  My friends and I had just about everything on the menu.  It's been great EVERY time.
My friends and i bring in our own beer too, but we take and throw away our bottles. We noticed a group of people with wine they brought in. When they were finished, one in the group stopped her friend when he tried to take the empty bottle away as they were leaving. F*ckers. I've noticed this tendency in people several times. The waitress stopped us when we offered to take it away for them.  THEY'RE TOO COOL. Do your part folks.
 
FYI there's a trash can just outside.
author: Jubei K.

description:
This place is not a 5 star Thai restaurant. Not here (SF), and honestly probably not anywhere. If I were hard up (see my Truckee review), perhaps we'd move in to 4-star territory. But here? HERE? No chance.

Service was quite polite, and I enjoyed that our dishes were served one at a time, each as they were prepared (could hear the wok being fired up each time), the flavors here were neither complex nor strong enough. I saw some reviews that mentioned watery sauces. I'm not sure I'd call them watery per-se, just not quite "all there". The quality of meats varied - pork was good, chicken was fine. The vegetables were fresh and well prepared. (White) rice was good but not great.

Add all that up and you get an even three stars, no change.
author: r g.

description: ordered a simple red curry, medium. The server told the red is milder than the green. It was so hot, spicy, that I returned it. The second time they served it  this dish was exactly the same.  I have eaten many curries so this one was disappointing.
author: Yolanda V.

description:
I've driven by this place a million times thinking about trying it. Finally decided to go in and try it for lunch today. It was as tiny as I thought it would be.

We ordered the tom yum gai, pad kee mao, and whatever number 41 was. I ordered the tom yum gai medium spicy and she warned us that it would still be pretty spicy. She did not lie. But it was delicious. Everything we ordered was good. The prices and sizes of dishes were average. I love how the tom yum gai came in a pot over a flame so our soup would stay warm if we didn't want to drink it all at once. That was awesome.

Will definitely be back and try more of their dishes.
author: Tiff L.

description:
Very very good Thai food. 
Better than King Of Thai and the price is fair.
Service is good.
author: Stephanie W.

description: When my Darling Devil Boy got cranky after a trip to the Richmond branch library children's department we toddled in here for lunch. Perfect! Cute child-drawn art kept D.S.B. engaged, I found the menu options noteworthy, and we both got dishes we enjoyed.  Crankypants were assuaged, at least for the moment, and the serving was big enough that we had extras for big sis when she got done with school.  Well worth checking out.
author: Tailypo W.

description: this place is pretty cute. but kind of small at the same time. we had a party of 8 here, and we had to sit kind of close together. we made reservations a week in advance. we had the tom yum gung soup here and it had the perfect kick to it! the pumpkin curry and their chicken with peanut sauce dish was good too. most of the people at my table loved the pad see ew the most.  the prices here are reasonable but parking is a pain! it was a friday night it and took us almost 30 mins to look for parking. i would recommend you arriving early just to give yourself enough time to look for parking.
author: Belinda C.

description:
This restaurant is adorable.  Great design.  Nice People.  Cozy.

The food was surprisingly good and extremely affordable.

I am going back and you should too!
author: Karen H.

description:
This place has definitely made its place among my favorite thai restaurants in the city... actually, wait... I think they may BE my favorite now.
The food is very tasty and not too greasy, and the service is extremely friendly.
I agree with the other reviewer than the whole trout with shredded mango is excellent.  The pan-fried noodle dishes are also worthy of mention, as are the penaeng curries.  And on top of all that, they're a BYOB joint... oh joy!  
The cherry on top? inexpensive, too.
author: Godot -.

description:
A solid middle-tier Thai restaurant.  Nothing extraordinary.  I don't think it's  better or worse than any of the other good Thai places on Geary or Clement (like Chiang Mai or Patpong.)  Tawan's childhood drawings on the walls are a nice touch.  'Medium' is plenty hot for me.  I'd hate to see what 'hot' is like.

This is one of those places where three stars is probably too low, but four is too high.  Oh well.
author: Eric W.

description:
Mmm...Tawan.  A co-worker turned me on to this cute little Thai place on Geary that I normally wouldn't have noticed, as I tend to avert my eyes away from the stores while on that street. 

Every time I've eaten there or ordered from there, the food has been delicious!  I highly recommend the Throng Thong (hee hee, Thong) appetizer as well as their curry dishes.
author: Suzanne L.

description:
This review concerns delivery only. 

SERVICE:

PROS: Very helpful and pleasant on the phone, which is nice because often delivery phone orders are stressful, especially when people don't speak English well and/or it's noisy in the restaurant. Delivery came exactly when they said it would.

CONS: Delivery took an hour. They did not seem to have a delivery minimum, but the woman on the phone told me I had to order "more than 2 items." It seemed expensive - $25 for 3 vegetarian dishes - but maybe my brain is just too lazy to do the math.

FOOD: I ordered three different dishes (why so much? because I had to, see above!), all vegetarian: Pad See-Ew, Gaing Ga-ree (yellow curry) and Pad Prik Khing.

PROS: The Pad See-Ew was good. It wasn't too greasy (rare for SF Thai take-out) and the flavor was yummy. This is my favorite dish so this is the most important one to get an edible version of. The Pad Prik Khing was okay - I liked the baby corn in it!

CONS: The yellow curry was disgusting. Usually it's a sweet, silky, coconut flavor with turmeric and coriander, wrapped around chunks of potato and carrot. This one tasted predominantly of the rank curry powder they sell pre-mixed in the spice section of the supermarket and was gritty, to boot! I wonder if someone knocked over the spice jar into my order? I almost didn't want to eat this, but by morning I was hungry enough to just wolf it down. The Pad Prik King was greasy (although I've never had this dish not floating in red grease) and not flavorful enough to counteract the grease.

SUMMARY: I would maybe order from here again, if I knew I wanted a non-greasy Pad See-ew, and I had no desire for curry. And I had an hour to wait. And enough people to eat three items.
author: Scrumptious S.

description: The som-tum salad was just okay. The pumpkin curry I had was deeelish,except for the fact the pumpkin could have been cooked a wee bit longer. They get an extra star for good service and were on top of their game with making sure I had enough water  =}
author: Zoeboe D.

description: pretty darn good thai in the rich.  I really liked the vegetarian egg-rolls.  crispy, not too greasy, and included glass noodles.  I had the green curry lunch special, and while tasty (and upon request, very spicy) it was a little watery and the chicken had a couple chewy bits.  though you probably won't be disappointed here, see my other reviews for my favorite thai place in the rich.
author: Sage S.

description: Hands down one of my favorite Thai places in the City! And it's not only because I live 2 steps away (okay maybe more like 1 block). Never noticed this tiny family-owned restaurant tucked away on a busy street even though I've probably walked by it a bazillion times. Saw all the rave reviews on yelp one day and I'm so glad I did! Their fried rice here is amazing, along with all of their appetizers. I love to try every single dish, so bring some friends and share everything family-style!
author: Vivian D.

description:
Tawan is the owner's son. He was a little kid when they opened the place and his drawings adorn the walls and the menu. While he gets pushed front-and-center, his mom is the real star here. My mom commented that with her cheery demeanor and pleasant voice, how could anyone ever possibly get upset with her? She's just constantly smiling while taking our orders.

We had a meal of excellent satay with a sweet peanut sauce. Then, we had a panang curry filled with veggies and chicken that was the right balance of sweet and spicy (we went medium). We also had a portion of sauteed pork in a sweet/sour/spicy sauce that came with fruit and vegetables.

You can order sodas or the ubiquitous Thai iced tea, or go next door and pick up some beer as they allow you to BYO.

For dessert, you can't go wrong with the FBI: fried banana with coconut ice cream.

Excellent, well-priced place that deserves multiple repeat visits.
author: Roy J.

description:
Friendly neighborhood restaurant.  This place can definately be described as cute.  It's small (6 or 7 tables) with artwork by the owner's son on the wall and menu.  The food is delicious and the atmosphere is great - take a date there.  I recommend the fried pompano fish if it's available and the chicken wings are a nice little indulgence.  All the other items I've had on the menu were well done with good layers of flavor as Thai food should have.  
Why not 5 stars?  I would give it 4.5 if possible but while the food is excellent, it's not "oh my god" - got to save the 5 stars for that.
author: matt d.

description: Delicious food, friendly service, and very reasonable prices. Very small and cozy. If I lived in the Richmond this would be a regular hang out for me for sure.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Very very friendly and creative atmosphere, great selection of food which is almost all very tasty. A tad pricey for Thai but compare it to any other fare in the city and you're saving money.

Been there a handful of times in the past few months and everything is quite consistent.

I like the squidy dish.
author: John Y.

description:
Tawan's is some of the best thai food I have had in SF.
The prices are reasonable.  The people that run it are super nice.  And the whole hand drawn menu by a five year old thing is super cute, especially since Tawan is actually a pre-teen now- check this place out and maybe you'll run into him.
author: donna m.

description:
don't let the size fool you - their menu is huge and tastes good!

the lady there was awesome - she worked the phones and 4 other tables all on her own, without missing a beat.  

non-traditional yet still thai.  give tawan a try
author: Jh M.

description:
Friday night, after gym class, starving. BF, takes me to a place he said he saw while roaming Geary Street. Very excited. Got in. Seated. No drinks served. Just sat, and looked at menu... (thinking wt...) 5 minutes later, two gents walk in, got seated, got chat up, got drinks, the server took their order. 5 minutes after waving our arms in the air, the waitress rolled her eyes and makes her way across the room to us. Ready? Yes. Can I get the Stuffed Chicken? Oh, we are out. But you can try something else. No. 
(Thinking I will not spend any more money here, then I have to, after being treated the way we were)
The other two people got their food, and was still chilling when we left...
I would have to say. Cute restaurant, and its good to develop relationships with customers, but this is A VERY BAD FIRST IMPRESSION TO NEW CUSTOMERS...
Btw, waitress came over gave us a card.. "we're going on vacation" so we won't be here.. 
(Thinking).. Oh good, we are never coming back to this place anyways...and took the card to rate this on YELP
author: Monika T.

description:
Good food, family owned and it reflects on the care they place in preparing the food. Not the best Thai food I have eaten, but certainly very good for the price we paid. 

Service was very good and the people were very nice. Would definitely go again.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Tawan's is one of the best in the city! 

I love their pad thai and yellow curry. I'm a vegitarian and my boyfriend is not and we are both completely satisfied when we eat there. He loves the Thai jerky (which can be hard to find). When ordering I have a hard time narrowing down what to get because it's all so good!
They deliver farther away than a lot of other places (thank you). I also love the drawings by Tawan. They really make me feel at home and fun when I go there. I hope one day they'll put some of those prints up for sale :)
author: Dani O.

description: Best Thai food in SF and maybe in the US. Worthy of my 100th review. Josh Gannis and I chose it over every other restaurant in SF!
author: Cara C.

description: I have been coming to Tawan's for over 10 years and it is my favorite place for Thai food in the city.  Their delivery service through Eat24 makes ordering from home super easy.  It's a little hole in the wall but I wouldn't have it any other way.  The food is super fresh and is such an amazing value.  Save room for desert - the roti is amazing!
author: Stephanie P.

description: Very disappointing service last night! When I called it was clear they were busy because I was on hold for a long time. Even after they took me off hold and started to take my order they kept interrupting me and asking me to hold on. At one point I said, "Are you too busy? Should I call a different restaurant?" They assured me they were not. I placed my order and they said it would arrive in 45 min. About 70 min later I called them and they said, "It's almost ready. It'll be there in about 40 min." When I expressed shock they said, "Sorry, we're really busy." They offered no remedy or compensation at all so I cancelled my order. If they had simply told me at the beginning that the order would take close to two hours, or if they had made any gestures to compensate me for the delay, I would not be writing this review.
author: Helena E.

description:
Five star food
One star service


I have been going here for four years. The food is amazing. Best pad sew ee. Mango sticky rice is such a great dessert. The food is amazing. 
HOWEVER, since Nikki has left, the service has gone down tremendously. The last time I went, last week, the service was horible. We went at 8:30 there was a party of eight at another table and our party of three. Not a lot of people. The server made us wait twenty minutes to order. She had a rude attitude when she spoke to us. She made no apologizes that our food took 40 minutes to get to our table. The food was amazing of course but the service was horrible. We paid the bill and proceeded to leave when the server runs out the door askin for more tip. Upon telling her how bad the service was I gave her more tip out of pity to the chefs and cooks in the kitchen because the horrible service we experienced was not their fault. Don't expect great tip if you didn't provide great service. Probably won't go back there until they get a new server.
author: Marc a.

description:
pros:

1) the panang curry, a red curry, was fantastic. we had it with beef, but i imagine it with anything would be over the top good.

2) the byob policy. they even refridgerated the stuff we weren't able to drink, which was really nice.

cons:

1) however, everything else was just ok. i found the flavors wanting. the veg green curry, ok. the tom yum gai soup: ok.  

for the price, it's good. but the place did not blow me out of the water like basil at 8th and folsom, or some other great places.
author: omar k.

description: Thanks Yelp! Had no idea this place existed until last night and now I am definitely feeling it. The yellow interior with all the little funny things was charming and the size of the restaurant gave this place a personalized feel. Staff was quick and friendly and got me my great Thai icetea on the double. My dish, the Panaeng curry with chicken was good, but certainly not the best I have had. My cohort had pad thai which was somewhat better. I feel like this place really has a lot of potential so I will be heading back here in the near future.
author: Sven S.

description: Loved it! The Yellow Curry is amazing. Perfectly-sized lunch portions. The staff was friendly and I would absolutely eat there again.
author: Betsey K.

description: We love Tawan when we have a craving for great Thai food! They are a small place on Geary with limited table space, so we usually have it delivered. They are so  friendly and deliver very quickly. The nice delivery man always says 'Enjoy your dinner" as he is leaving.  Also, they will leave out the fish sauce if you ask.
author: Carol G.

description: Great casual place to eat a few times a week! Good Thai food, dependable, delicious. I like the cho chee curry, in fact, all the curries. The must-order is the deep fried stuffed chicken wings appetizer. I've had this at other places but this is by far the best. This is a great neighborhood restaurant, too lazy to cook, go-to place.
author: Chelsea W.

description: Our favorite place to order out for Thai!  We always order the stuffed chicken wings and silver noodle soup.  We've experimented with a number of dishes but found their specials to be the best.  When ordering by phone be sure to ask about them.
author: J M.

description: There are so many Thai restaurants around here, it really is hard to know where to go. So THANK YOU to those of you who recommended this place. I went there tonight it it was great. Food was excellent quality, and the place has a very positive vibe.
author: Kent W.

description: Great Thai take-out here.  Their stuffed chicken wings actually have tender chicken meat on them, rather than consisting mainly of deep fried battered skin and stuffing.  In tom yum goong soup, I usually prefer straw mushrooms...they use regular button mushrooms at Tawan's, but the mushrooms were very tender and and full of flavor.  The pad thai could have a bit more shrimp added to it, but it's comparable to pad thais at other local restaurants, and the pad thai noodles were fresh and well seasoned.  Many thanks to the yelper who posted pics of Tawan's menu on this site, it was very helpful.
author: Sherry N.

description: I went here on a coworker's recommendation.  He said it was the best  Thai in the city.  So I go here one night.  The menu with the drawings is really cute and the staff are friendly and nice.  But the food is just... bland.  I mean, not just it was like all the millions of other Thai places that all taste the same, but just no flavor.  I even tried what my wife ordered and same deal.  I don't know what it is.  It's too bad because otherwise this place was great.  But the food kinda is a dealbreaker.
author: Nessie V.

description: A great place for Thai. The food is awesome. I loved the yellow curry, green curry, and chicken with cashews and celery. The other reasons I love it are that it is BYOB, so you can pop next door to the liquor store and buy beer without paving restaurant markup. It is small and has tons of character (though I think the lights are too bright in there.) The waitresses are SO nice.
author: Andrea F.

description: They answered the phone right away, took the order without any problems, and got the food here in half the time promised. Only took 20 mins. It was hot, not greasy, and delicious. And I asked for it extra spicy and they delivered on that. Good noodles, and massive fresh springrolls.
author: Sidney B.

description: Friendly service, great veggie egg rolls, and the pad thai had mushrooms, broccoli, green beans, and baby corn, which I usually don't see in pad thai. Win! Nice decor too-- little framed pictures drawn by Tawan.
author: Ellie W.

description:
My friend Joe took me here. He speaks slowly, he eats slowly, but he's "cool-like-dat." So Joe says, "Meet me at Tawan's." I had never heard of the place, but that's because it suffers from "If you blink you miss it" syndrome, like so, so, so many good things and opportunities in life. So I decided not to miss out, and not to blink just this one time. It was worth it. They give new meaning to family style: Tawan himself was there. Now at the time, I think Tawan was about 5 or 6 years old. Jokingly, after an awesome Pad Ki Meeeeoow, I said, "Compliments to Tawan." The owners looked at me, laughed and nudged a little kid drawing with a pen at the table. "Whhhhaaat???" I said. SlowJoe leaned over, "Dude, he he, that's Tawan." The kid smiled.  I'm sure it wasn't the first time this has happened. HA HA the Jokes on Johne-ne! The food is inexpensive, wholesome, tasty Thai grub. And you get to sit around saying, "How cool is it that this preschooler has a restaurant named after him!!" 

3 duckets for the food, 1 for Tawan.
author: Johnny C.

description: A little jewel.  The menu has drawings made by their son ... adorable.  The food is decent and reasonably priced.  The staff is incredibly friendly.
author: Blu n.

description: A streamlined Thai menu, with all of my favorite Thai classics. Being a picky Thai food connoisseur, whenever I go to a Thai restaurant I always implement the basic staples test.....if they can't do fried rice or phad thai well, then I won't bother trying anything else, or returning. Happy to report that Tawan's passed with flying colors and best of all, they deliver. :-)
author: Suepattra M.

description:
the artwork on the walls, tables, and menus are all created by the owners' son. That alone gets them 5 stars cause my parents put my art on the fridge and tacked it up in my room and thats about as far as it got. our tablecloth was decorated with a octopus creature - SO GREAT! 
they have a vegetarian menu which includes appetizers - YAY. me andn my friend got the fried tofu, a little too dried out for our tastes but we were like hungry hippos shoveling in our mouths anyway. both of us got pad thai (we're so unoriginal) mine being veg of course. the waitress was kind enough to ask if it was ok to use egg in mine (answer: HELL YES). it was good, nice and hot which was just what i needed since it was super cold outside. i wont say its the best i've had but its pretty dang good. prices are reasonable and my friend highly approves of the fact that they deliver (she's taken advantage of this many times).
author: Jenn L.

description: The chicken panaeng curry was AMAZING. Not overly spicy (I ordered a medium), but definitely tickled my tongue with sweet goodness. Definitely reminded me of some of the curries I had in Thailand.
author: Teresa Y.

description: actually 3 1/2 stars. We had the chicken angel wings. it was ok a little dry probably over fried. My friend said it did not taste fresh. We also had curry bamboo shoots w/chicken. that was ok too pretty spicy. Sorry bout the bad points but the Gang Dang (flat noodles with broccoli and pork) It was good really good. And the roti was also fresh. the food was good overall. but the service was tough cause they only have 1 server. good spicy food guys.
author: Mark F.

description: Tawan's is a great local Thai food secret treasure.  As soon as  you walk in to this restaurant you feel at home, the bright yellow painting on the walls are cozy and inviting, as well, original drawings from the owner's son are featured on the menus and decorations.  Best of all the food is equally warm and inviting!  Delicious, and fresh!  Our favorites are certainly the golden bags (tasty curry treats in crispy pockets), tom yum gung (spicy and sour soup with shrimp that warms the soul), green curry anything and the noodle dish pad see-ew (equally fun to say as to eat!)   WARNING: Food is seriously spicy, unless you like fire mouth order mild hotness and you will still enjoy a nice spice!  If you are lucky enough to live in the neighborhood they do deliver and you may even meet, Tawan, the place's namesake and talented young artist!!
author: Lori T.

description:
This place is ok, not that great. You should come to this place with some food in your stomach, because the wait for food is very long. The place only has like 6 tables and one waitress, the owner. There's like one kitchen staff also when the other owner is out on delivery. My friend and I went there pretty hungry, but it took forever for the waitress to take our order and then we had to wait for other tables to get their food first also. 
The food was decent. The Tom Yum Gung soup was average, although I don't think they can mess that up. Then we had green curry with chicken, which wasn't that great. I've had much better green currys. The pad see eew on the other hand was really good. There was enough grease and hot fire to make it scrumptious. If I go back again, I won't be getting another curry, but a stir fry dish. 
Oh yea, I realized this is another chinese run business, because they speak cantonese there.
author: dI c.

description: Best Thai fish cakes in San Francisco.  First visit, the yellow curry was also great.  I need to come back and try some more dishes.  Since Pad Thai changed management this is probably the best midrange Thai in SF.
author: Darrin C.

description: Very cute, small place.  I had pad see-ew(I never know how to spell it and am somewhat relieved that every Thai place that has it has a different spelling) and it was good.  Extensive menu, friendly staff, takes credit card.  The food was only good, but I really do like the environment a lot.
author: Heidi P.

description:
Looks like I'm not the only one who likes this place. I thought that this was a hidden gem...but apparently not with all these reviews.  My kids and I go there for lunch after the pediatrician check up.  It's usually not packed so I always wonderd what it was like at night.  I guess it's busy.... as it should be.  

The food is homecooked & lovely.  My kids beg me to go there. They love Pad see-ew and the little trinkets they sell.

 I love the crab fried rice and the curries. It is authentic and when in Thailand that is whats its like.  Every resturant has a style and when you find one that has the love cooked in ...you can taste it.  

Go for lunch... it's less crowded!
author: Claudia M.

description: A teeny tiny brightly colored Thai joint with a cozy atmosphere. The service was good & the food your standard tasty thai (but nothing to write home about). The prices are reasonable & the dessert delicious, there's no reason not to go here!
author: Melisser E.

description:
Tawan's rocks!  This is my favorite Thai place, and even though I've moved to the East Bay I still come over here every couple weeks to get my fix.  Love the Red Curry w/ Pumpkin, and the Tom Khar Gai.  The food is really spicy and complex, and the people who work here are very nice.

Warning on the spicy:  They mean it!  They aren't dumbing down the spiciness for western palettes, so even you really like things spicy, asking for "medium" will probably do it for you.
author: Isaac R.

description: The pad see whe was good, yet they had broccoli in it, which was a twist to the dish, but good.  I had the green curry as well which was lacking flavor.  I vote stick to the noodle dishes.
author: Nicole F.

description: I was very disappointed in the service here. I called for delivery order and they refused to deliver to our apartment building even though we are located about 1/2 mile from the store.
author: Bethany T.

description: Decided to give this place a try as I'm really into Thai food. Based on the 4 stars on Yelp, I had rather high-expectations. Decided to order 4 dishes to-go. Well, food was worse than worse. Pad See Ewe had so much black pepper it was inedible. Ordered a broccoli and mushroom dish with tofu for $11 and there was no tofu, and the broccoli and mushrooms were slopped with sauce. $11 for soggy vegetables? You have to be kidding me. I feel like I got royally ripped off by this place. I complained to the restaurant and they told me to bring the food into them to show them how "horrible" it was. Definately not authentic Thai and you definitely don't get what you pay for. I'm all for supporting small family-run restaurants, but I might as well stick to the big Osha chain from now on.  If I had gotten better customer service or at least offered a refund, I wouldn't be writing this review. Give this place 1 star for their good Chinese spring rolls.
author: Daniel F.

description:
I found this place on Yelp when I was craving take-out and Ploy II was closed, and I don't really see what all the fuss is about!  The lady who took my order over the phone was rude and the food is mediocre - the potatoes were really overboiled in the yellow chicken curry I ordered and the flavor so-so.

I guess it's fine for takeout, but I've had much better food at many Thai places in the city - from Marnee to Ploy II to even King of Thai.  I probably will do more research on places that do delivery next time.
author: Meg B.

description: I've ordered here a few times and every time it is DELICIOUS. So far, the best Thai I've experienced here since moving from Berkeley. Try the yellow curry with potatoes and chicken. They make it spicier than any yellow curry I've had and it's fantastic. When you say spicy, they actually make it spicy. I ordered delivery a few times before I actually went to the restaurant, and it's so cute! Yellow walls and flowers and a lot of the decorations are jewelry that, if you like it, you can buy! So far there is nothing I can say in the negative about this place. Maybe it's a couple dollars more expensive than some other thai places, but the food is better too, so you get what you pay for.
author: j s.

description: Josh Gannis loves Tawan's Thai. Especially when Tawan delivers it himself. Go with the Pad Prik Sod. Josh Gannis loves the Pad Prik Sod
author: Josh G.

description: If I could graphically illustrate my review, it would go like this:  A stick figure with flames on his/her tongue and an arrow and the word "them" next to it.  (That would represent other yelpers.)  A stick figure with a flameless tongue sticking out, and then a picture of the flame with a question mark next to it.  (That would represent me.)  I didn't have any spice, which is fine since I'm on the wimpy side anyway. If I'd said "mai pet" rather than "not spicy", would that mean I'd have gotten more spice?  The food was great at any rate, and I went with a friend who's been going for years and told me about the place.  She's even gotten friends the belts & funky jewelry they sell there.  I agree w/other yelpers that the kid's drawings on the walls & in the menu make for a really fun atmosphere.  Definitely going back- and will order a medium spicy dish next time!
author: Kate K.

description: A really good excuse to find yourself on this portion of Geary is Tawan's. This cute and tiny (I mean, intimate. Or cozy perhaps)canary yellow Thai restaurant is a really great place for a first date. The food is delicious and inexpensive, which should eliminate those, "who's gonna pick up the tab" mental debates because hey, YOU can pick up the tab! The place is decorated with the cutest darn drawings you'll ever see (done by Tawan himself), a DIY-lovers paradise. It's also BYOB , a detail I always appreciate in a restaurant, with a liquor store conveniently situated next door. Alize and Pad Seew anyone? Leave with your own little piece of Tawan cuteness to commemorate your experience by purchasing a shirt or other merch that's for sale there. What more can you ask for?
author: Lainya M.

description: Mmm, I love this place... the drawings by Tawan are cute/ hillarious "Hi, I'm Mr. Clocky!" and the food is excellent!!  I've had the coconut soup  (medium spicy, which was enough for me!), the cashew chicken, and the red curry salmon (which was the best piece of salmon I have eaten in my life!!) and I've also had bites off of other people's plates... everything was top notch.  I could come here again and again and again... plus it's so inexpensive!  Aaaand it makes my boyfriend happy that he can bring a 6-pack of Newcastle with him (they even bring you ice-cold frosted glasses and pour your beer for you). So, 5 stars from me!!
author: Laura W.

description:
this place is cute. god, i just felt my manhood drop two points. im going to have a hell of a time explaining my -1 stat to friends.

lots of homemade jewelry hangs on the walls, ready for a generous buyer. the framed drawings by Tawan add a great family feel, and you just plain feel good about offering your patronage to the restaurant.

now the food was very tasty, and although ive had larger portions at other places (like Little Thai on Polk), my friend and i left agreeably full. prices are reasonable, staff is friendly, and the decor is bright and oh so cute.

-2 Manhood

dammit.
author: Darrell L.

description: I LOVE this place! My favorite take out/Delivery food by far. They always deliver our order fast, hot and the food is always tasty and fresh. I recommend the Vegetarian egg rolls, Pad Thai and the Prawn Fried Rice. We always request everything without fish sauce (because I can't stand it) and they are happy to accomadate (I'm sure they think it's weird though :). Oh, if you want to eat there, the place is super cute and family is very sweet. You may catch a glimpse of Tawan himself!
author: Mighty D.

description:
i fell in love with this place as soon as i walked in. it's that authentic cozy family owned restaurant that you've been searching for to be your next favorite place to eat. the ambiance is pretty bare besides the drawings that the real Tawan made when he was little, which makes it even cuter. 

but enough about the atmosphere, the food was amazing. really fresh, perfect spicyness. i shared the pad kee mao and panang (sp?) curry with some friends which i would definitely order again. the waitress lady forgot to bring our pumpkin curry but she was so sweet about it when we told her that it didn't even matter that we had to wait an extra few minutes. that was awesome also. mmmm...and the tom yum soup, my favorite. i have tried it at a lot of thai restaurants and the flavor of this one was PERFECT.

basically, this restaurant made my day :)
author: april s.

description: Tried to order delivery, but a recorded message said this place was closed until July 15.  (Note: I didn't want to rate this, just give the update, but that was not possible. I'll re-rate after they re-open.)
author: sam h.

description: I love Tawan's so much...great food, friendly people, and family-run.  I can honestly say that when I went to Thailand a few years ago, I only had a couple of meals that were better than the food at Tawan's.  It's so much better than the more popular Thai places around town.  Any red curry dish is a must, as is the Pad Kee Mow - so delicious!!
author: d h.

description: Maybe I went on a bad day but the food quality was very poor.  The pad thai with shrimp was especially bad, and the shrimp was beyond it's freshness date.  Maybe I could have excused that but another fish dish was also quite questionable in the freshness department.
author: Lea D.

description: I live a couple blocks away from here but never thought to give it a try until my friend recommended it to me because they said it was really good. So glad I gave it a try! It's such a cute little place to be eating in! Excellent food and never too greasy. I love the Panaeng Gai Yarng which is a curry dish with white meat chicken, mushroom, bell pepper, and red curry in coconut milk. Pad Thai was also delicious. Really delicious. Prices are definitely affordable too.
author: Juliane N.

description: Super yummy food and cute pictures on the wall. Not as good as Royal Thai (see my review) but very good service and fresh vittles.
author: Colin S.

description: I ate here once last summer & I've been meaning to go back ever since. It's tiny, run by a family & named after their son. Incidentally, it's also one of the best thai food experiences I've ever had in San Francisco.
author: Pete J.

description: Cute. Oh so cute. Yellow walls adorned with Tawan's artwork - which is also for sale and on display for Tawan merchandise. Love it when family owned businesses encourage the arts and entrepreneurship! Love the pa see ew here. BYOB.
author: Judy L.

description: seriously, i don't know why i was feeling meh about tawan's when i reviewed it originally.  i eat there constantly, pretty much whenever i look into the fridge, shudder, then decide i am eating out.  it's my go-to, and i was super sad when they took a month off to vacation like normal people do.  yeah, it's convenient for me, but it is also super delicious and cute and has great service.  and i still love the coconuts.
author: ehnonymus ..

description: When you step into Tawan's it's as if you've stepped into a Thai person's kitchen--space is cozy and food is authentic.  Don't expect numbered specials like those at Thai restaurant chains.   It's a simple menu, but you're sure to find something that's comparable to what more mainstream Thai restaurants offer.  Wait staff is super friendly and they gladly told me how old is Tawan (the boy who did all the drawings--he's in high school).
author: Marie B.

description: The delivery took awhile on Friday night, but food was worth the wait.  Good quality especially for delivery.
author: Andrew R.

description: I love this place, the food is always really good, the decor is great, and it just feels like a happy place. I think the bright yellow paint makes for the happy, but it could be the funny drawings. On the downside, it is TINY, and sometimes it can be a bit too crowded for comfort, and the service can be kind of slow- but always friendly. Anyhoo, it never stopped me from going there before and will not stop me now. I am getting hungry just thinking about the Pad Prik Sod... oooh, and bonus- it's fairly cheap too!
author: Jeannine S.

description: Great Food. I don't know whether its lame or cute to use drawings by a kid to use as decorations on the wall. Not only that, but to sell his drawings also at the counter.
author: Prescott T.

description: Reliably very good. Not too greasy! Friendly service. AND the lunch specials are a very good portion size - I hate getting 4 times more than I can eat.
author: Amy E.

description: Ahh yes, another restaurant where I find myself as a regular. Its a pretty small but cozy place to eat. There is only one waiter and she happens to be the sweetest waiter who always remembers the regulars that come in and welcomes all in such a friendly, warm manner. The main dish I always get is the Thai Fried Rice (beef). The seasoning they put is to die for. Definitely beats King of Thai's because it leaves my mouth fully satisfied with its authentic taste and savoring flavor. The red curry and green curry is also good as well.
author: mae e.

description: Food was good- got a big delivery order.  Called the day before, asked for plates & utensils & gave my credit card number.  Fast forward to next day: food comes, no utensils, no plates, no credit card.  BUT the driver was nice, didn't seem annoyed, took my card back to the restaurant, and brought me back a receipt & the stuff I had originally asked for.  I'll definitely call again.
author: Maria L.

description:
Disappointed.I order delivery from here tonight. They first weren't going to delivery it because the ave i was on i need to spend atleast 10more dollars.They said the min for 25ave and up is around 30bucks.WTF that pretty high to have since my house is a 3min drive.Anyways they said they would let me slide with 20dollars this time.
So they told me 45mins max before my food would get here.Took an hour and 10mins.But my food was still warm and my dessert was still cold and the hard rain outside i let it slide.
The food is medicore and the portions are not big.I hate 2 dinners to feel full and no I'm not a fast ass I'm a 145lbs and 5'11 close to a stick.The pad Thai was alright Ive had better.The dessert sucked Ive ordered fried banana with honey from other Thai restaurants and its great there, but it was nasty i think they forgot the honey.The ice cream was good.But overall this place is overpriced and their min for delivery suck.Yes i know they need to have them because of gas.But the Thai place up one block told me 15buck min to bring it out to me.
Overall i will not be ordering from here.I would go to my normal Thai place but its all the way in the sunset.
+for decent food
+ice cream that I've been craving
author: Jonathan M.

description: I was actually kind of disappointed in this place. When I first went it was at 4.5 stars, but I guess more people reviewed it and saw it for what it was. In any case, it's pretty typical for a Thai place, and esp in a city like San Francisco, it's nothing special.
author: Simon L.

description: So many good Thai Restaurants in the neighborhood, this isn't near among the top. Today I spent $8.00 for chicken (unusally dry strips) over rice with vegtables and with much to my amazment the order was small, mostly rice with chicken broth over it, no gravy and slices of 2 oz of vegetables. Slow to order, but do cook to order, just don't be in any hurry. Defintely a mom and pop. No tahi spices whatsoever in this dish. A waste of $8.00!
author: Dan H.

description: Thai at it's best.  The soups are perfectly balanced, and the dishes are tasty and not too greasy.  All the ingredients seemed to be really fresh, and although the dish size is not as large as other restaurants but the overall quality makes up for that fact.  Plus their theme is pretty cute!  I love looking at all the drawings by Tawan.
author: Violet S.

description: This is a cute, bright, cheery, & welcoming little restaurant that cooks up the best Thai food around.  Way better than Marnee.  The food always seems to be prepared with fresh ingredients and your choice of spiciness.  Beware, hot here is more like the authentic hot.  We've been coming here for years now & it's still number one!  Everything's good here.  Please try it, you will not be disappointed!
author: Coco S.

description: This is great Thai food. If someone suggest going to King of Thai, I will not be their friend. I don't know what else to say because everyone else said everything I was thinking. Go eat here!!!
author: Lola S.

description: It's an intimate, cute, family restaurant, where good food blends with little details like the drawings on the menus or the little shapes in the cans. Humble but cozy, silent but warm
author: Alex A.

description: One of the BEST thai places in city.  The red curry is the perfect consistency and flavor. Everyone that works there is incredibly friendly.  And you gotta love Tawan's drawings.
author: JB S.

description: this place has some pretty amazing food... nice decor, friendly waitress... had the stuffed chicken wings, they were so good... ask them for extra sauce.... i also had the crab cakes and those were heavenly.... just these 2 alone with some rice will stuff u till late dinner!!!
author: Chan T.

description: always nice. Chicken Pad Thai rocks. Get the coconut. good place.
author: Logan S.

description: Love this place!!! I like getting my thai food from this cute tiny restaurant. I usually get the pad-see-ew, soooooo good! I like the fact that the portion is a good amount and the take out container is microwavable/reusuable.
author: Gina C.

description: Small Thai restaurant with creatively -designed menu and art.  The food is excellent and the service is extremely friendly.
author: Bill B.

description: I dream about this cozy restaurant and whenever the owners go back to Thailand I go crazy and crave their food. Whenever I eat here I feel at home and it reminds me of the roadside cooking I long for in places like Chiang Mai, Thailand. Try the nuer kem - Thai beef jerky, and my favorite dish is guay-tiaw pad kee-mao - pan fried noodles with vegetables, add meat. Aroy mak mak!
author: Alex R.

description: Unfortunately the place seems to be heading downhill.... quite a few of the dishes seem to be pre-boiled with sauce added just prior to serving
author: T S.

description: This place is fantastic.  I got a pretty basic dish, but it was very flavorful (and spicy!).  Very small, and nice for a low key meal.
author: Richard N.

description:
Tawan's Thai Food was a great experience! My friend brought me there just last week and the crab fried rice was awesome! Really good prices for really great food!

Plus the menu illustrator is a kid! You can't pass up the cute kid art!
author: Anna S.

description: This is by far the best Thai in the Inner Richmond of SF, possibly the best in SF, or possible the best in the Bay ha ha, ;-) But it is definitely the best in the Inner Richmond. I used to love King of Thai (on Clement) and Thai Noodle Jump (on 6th and Balboa), until I tried Tawan's delicious menu. Tawan's is the best, hands down. Get the Pumpkin Curry/Red Curry extra spicy style, and try some Tom-Yum Noodle Soup also extra spicy. Tawan's does not disappoint. Try their roti (Thai pancake) too, it is sweet and perfect for dunking in the curry. Also if you go here, try something new that you wouldn't normally try; stretch your wings because Tawan's cooks with love. Also, if you are new to this place try being friendly and not stuck-up, then you are bound to receive excellent service like me and my lady did! We got free Roti on the house! All PROS, and no CONS!
author: Charles Y.

description:
Delicious Mom and Pop Thai Restaurant

My roommate has been living here for 10 years and says he doesn't go anywhere else for Thai food. After trying it myself I have to agree wholeheartedly.

The staff = extremely nice

The food = delicious

The price = right

One recommendation, unless you absolutely love getting your mouth burned off by incredible spicy goodness...I would stay away from anything other than mild.
author: Andrew B.

description: This little joint on Geary is a wonderful Thai place. Don't let the casual atmosphere fool you -- the food is absolutely delicious! The staff works hard and is friendly, and you get quick service. The food is not expensive at all and it is really, really tasty. I go to a lot of Thai places but this one rates at the top of my list.
author: leigh w.

description: We ordered 3 items for delivery last night. It cost thirty backs, took 30 minutes to arrive and everything was delicious. What more could you want. I can't believe we didn't stumble across this place sooner.
author: Paul S.

description:
I think people are being a little over generous with these five star ratings.

Dont get me wrong, the food IS good, and it is nice to eat in a 'family restaurant' but there is a downside to a restaurant that is so small, the WAITING. I dont mind that there is only one waiter, not really a big deal in a place with five tables, but the food just has to come out quicker!

Three of us came in on a weekday night at about 6:30, sat right down and ordered promptly - It took 40 minutes for us to get any food, no exaggeration. I dont care how cute and well designed the menu is when I am starving.

Worth checking out - but beware of the potential waiting.
author: Aaron F.

description: My date and I went to this restaurant last minute instead of Salt House because she was running late due to traffic and weather. We were both starving and craved Thai food and didn't want to wait until after 10 pm since other places were booked on friday night! I wanted to take her to something other than OSHA or other popular places around here. I had called earlier to make reservations but they said it wasn't busy. We arrived and were seated immediately! I wanted to try something different than what I am used to so I ordered an appetizer, Thep Sa-Wei which is a crispy crepe filled w/ ground shrimp, ground chicken, grated coconut meat, ground peanut tofu and scallions. The rest of the dishes were excellent although the Hot n' Sour soup we ordered was a little too spicy even for medium. The menu was really cute and artsy but the service was a little slow due to many patrons and that's why I give it 4 out of 5 stars. I would definitely recommend it and eat there again!
author: Neo23 T.

description: We would probably give this 3 stars, but it got a 4 because of the selection.  The menu is pretty extensive, and there are a lot of vegetarian choices.  The food is decent.  The server was nice, and pointed out a number of his favorite dishes for us even though he was pretty busy and dealing with to-go/pick-up orders.
author: Howard-Daisy L.

description: this place is amazing, and on top of that, they deliver!! the pad thai is the perfect texture and juiciness. the chicken noodle soup i got was also very flavorful, not oily and no traces of msg. chunks of chicken meatballs, very good. also the red curry with eggplant is awesome. very interesting mixture of different flavors. some of the best red curry i've ever had. the curry is more thick than watery, thus doesn't seem as oily. rice was solid too. definitely going to become my standard thai delivery place. only catch is it's $20 min for delivery, but they take credit,  yea!
author: Jessica W.

description: This is a cute place.  As others have mentioned, the owners' son, Tawan, contributed the endearing drawings on the wall and menu; our favorite was "Squidy" the Squid.  (Tawan is now probably in his 20s, judging by a review posted on the wall of the restaurant.)  I've dined in the restaurant once and had food delivered once.  Both times, the food was good but not great.  They seem to have a somewhat spicier take on "medium spicy" than most Thai places I've been to around here, so next time I'll swallow my pride and order "mild-to-medium."  The pad see ew is tasty and the cucumber salad is refreshing.  Service in the restaurant was friendly and delivery was quick.    Overall, a good bet for solid Thai, especially if you're looking for delivery and live in the area.
author: Jenny G.

description: My wife and I have been through three or four delivery thai places to find one we both liked. After finding Tawan's, we need look no further. The pad see-ew is fantastic, and the spicy ground beef-filled dumplings are outstanding as well.
author: b w.

description: 3.5 Stars - A really cute place with great service, but the food was a bit anti-climactic esp since I have great access to the TL where the Thai food is overflowingly good. Pad Thai (I know I know....so generic) was way too sweet. Tasted like candy... The curry was pretty delicious, but nothing I'd be drooling over to come back to - word of advice, if you want more authentic thai head over to either Thai House Express (Larkin) or Ler Ros Thai.
author: Jeannette L.

description: this is my favorite place to eat! when i lived in the richmond my roomate and i would literally eat here 3 times a week. the food is fabulous! the best thai food you can get in san francisco. all the veggies are super fresh! you can even get a 6-pack from the liquor store next door and bring it in!
author: alexis s.

description: I was super impressed with this little family run Thai Restaurant. The food is pretty authentic and very tasty, and the setting is intimate. It's some of the best Thai food I've had in SF - on a par with Thep Prahnom and Marnee Thai. I prefer Tawan's over those places because it's smaller and feels closer to the experience of eating in a family run Thai restaurant in Thailand. The only problem is that they close for 1 month of the year because the family goes back to Thailand. Kind of annoying, but it also gives it more character. Call ahead to see if they are open.
author: Adrian K.

description: They had mango sticky rice and it was delish.  Food above average.  Nice  family atmosphere.
author: Tom L.

description: So my Boyfriend and I love Thai and have been looking around our neighborhood but found this place on Geary. It takes us 10 min to get there but is well worth the heating up when ordering take-out. The inside is really small so don't bring groups but if you want some good spicy thai... go here. Oh, I had the green curry. It was awesome.
author: Courtney W.

description: Authentic Mom and Pop Thai restaurant in the Richmond. If you order Tom Yum Goong soup at the highest hotness level, be prepared to have your sinuses instantly cleared for a week! Tasty food at good prices. Besides the Tawan drawings everyone else already mentioned, the small dining area has plain decor.
author: M. W.

description: food here is good, but i like the ambiance best, its quaint sorta like a living room because i think the whole family hangs out there.. I'm sure I've see Tawan around, and my favorite part is that they have his little kid drawings featured in the menu... they also sell jewelry on the wall. how entrepreneurial :) cute place with bright art painting on the door, foods tasty price is right
author: sharon e.

description: Tawan has some of the best Thai food in SF. I have never had a bad dish, and for the price (most dishes are between $6-9) it could possibly be THE best Thai restaurant in the city. The service is great, it has a nice family feel to it and the Mango rice dessert will make you leave feeling happy every time.
author: ajwest f.

description: Best Thai food in the city.  I highly recommend the Pad Ped, Garlic and Pepper Chicken, and the silver noodle salad. The space is cute and charming, very small. BYOB
author: Kristina N.

description: Pretty good! The Pad Thai was a little bit dry, just ask for some extra of their amazing peanut sauce and you are in business. The chicken satay was amazing as were the egg rolls.
author: Carmen V.

description: overrated. the curries are so-so. an array of very uninspiring dishes. service is good.
author: aj s.

description: this place is okay. i've definitely had better thai.  the pra ram long song was edible but bland. it really needed a slightly spicier curry, more peanut sauce, and maybe a little salt. the egg rolls were... meh. on the upside, the waitstaff was very nice and there was no wait (monday afternoon). i dunno... maybe it's cause this is the first time i've tried the place, so maybe i didn't order the right thing, but i honestly don't see what all the 4 & 1/4 star fuss is about.
author: Melissa A.
